reviewTitle: Convenient to go most of the places via Bts and Mrt
reviewText: I spent four days in Bkk and used the Bts skytrain everyday and found it was very convenient to go to those places of interest or shopping areas And the Bts was also interconnected with the Mrt and other subway lines making the journey smoother compared to taking taxi whereby you would be caught in the jam or long wait at traffic lights But the Bts is getting quite crowded with all the tourists and local people taking the rides maybe the authorities can consider making upgrades to the system
This is very easy to use You do need to get change first and then use the change in the ticket machine It cost us 35Baht each way

reviewTitle: Great for getting around Bangkok city
reviewText: The train is clean and efficient and gets you to pretty much anywhere in the heart of Bangkok city Purchasing of ticket is also easy as there are 3 way to do it over the counter automated machine which only accepts coins automated machine which accepts both cash and coins (good for purchasing multiple tickets) There are also clear signage for exits to attractions nearby the BTS station

I always try and have change ready for the public transport ticket machines in bangkok  Food & drink is not allowed to be consumed whilst using the sky train  If monks don't have a place to sit it's good etiquette to offer them your seat  Sometimes security will ask to glance into your bag on your way into the station best to get it open ready if you see checks ahead so you can go through more quickly
very busy train and rude people anyone could have been hurt at anypoint no english speaking people either once we were there

reviewTitle: Skip the hassles with the taxi and the tuk tuk drivers and take great public transport!
reviewText: It is so easy to get around Bangkok on the BTS or to get to the international airport (BKK) that I cannot imagine why people put up with the hassle of the taxi or tuk tuk drivers  For 145 baht you can get a 24 hour pass but in fact you probably wouldn't spend that much so individual tickets which range from about 1538 baht are probably your best bet  Get a map of the routes and travel like a local
nice and cool try to avoid rush hour but at the end there is even a foreign ticket office if you want to catch the train downstairs to Chang Mai

reviewTitle: Excellent depending on were your going
reviewText: Very good for getting round most of the city but sadly some of the major tourist stops are not serviced

Bangkok BTS lines are very good choices to avoid the horrible traffic jam in Bankok cities The BTS lines covered most of the tourist attraction as well as nearby hotel However there are still a number of improvements required to consider by the management The ticket machines are always queue up by the passenger due to the not user friendly system and the small assembly hall You have to ready sufficient coins otherwise you have to queue up for money exchange  If you are more than two passengers sometimes it's cheaper to take a meter taxi than BTS Furthermore the very limited escalators or lifts that not very convenient to the people with disabilities or tourist with luggages

reviewTitle: Provides Good Links to Many Areas at Bangkok City
reviewText: The BTS provides good links to several areas at Bagkok City Centre  Tickets per ride between 45 stations were in the region of THB25
If traveling around Bangkok if you are near the BTS use it 150 baht will get you a day pass till 1200am So many places to see
Easy to use DIY tkt machine Just remember to bring small notes to purchase tks You need to exit station  walk to another station and buy another ticket if you need to transfer train
Got caught up in rain so the traffic wasn't moving  sky train was a good way of actually making progress Only downside is the limited coverage
Reliable German engineering with all signs and announcements in Thai and English It's fast simple and beats the traffic at nearly any time of day

Well not exactly but it will take you to many parts of Bangkok you will want to go to In comfort Aircon A little tight in peak hours But only occasional lady boy want make body contact but easy stop that So safe Frequent Cheap

Bangkok's traffic can be very bad Also the rush hour here extends over many hours The BTS sky train is the solution Just stick to it for as many travels as possible and job will be able to predict travel times Even when some place is not directly reachable by the train we took a train to a place close by and then would walktaxituktuk Every time we took a taxi we would immediately regret And not because it was cheaper to take the train  for a family of 4 the train is sometimes more expensive than taxi For one or two people it's cheaper too
Air conditioned trains every few minutes that cover most of the city  what more could  traveller want for such low fares
Clean cheap and fast way of traveling around BK   You just need to count stations you want to travel on old ticket machines  42 bath for 8 stations

The BTS Skytrain was very easy to use and well marked All cars have great air conditioning We bought the one day pass that allowed you to ride to any stations all day 140Baht per pass Staff is courteous and professional  Jon
I'm from NYC and COULD NOT BELIEVE just how clean the subway system is  I only wish that it went more places

BTS saves everyone who boards it from the traffic of bangkokespecially during the evening BTS is on timeclean and fast and you won't even realise there's chaos on the roads below your BTS tower A must for city like bangkok
I stay at Sukhumvit so I travel on this every time I am in Bangkok Always clean and fast service Avoid it at work start times and at 5 to 7pm its nuts
The BTS is a must if you want to beat the infmaous Bangkok traffic It's clean and very cheap and has been extended over the years to serve a lot of Bangkok
Great way to get around Fast cheap easy to use and easy to navigate Can get crowded during peak times Getting around Bangkok would be a nightmare without this service

reviewTitle: Easy access to every part of the city!
reviewText: clean and organised train services around the city but was surprised that they don't have cards available for tourists for us to have unlimited access during short stay so we need to buy every time we need to use BTS Anyway easy and hassle free transaction all the time )

we were there 2 parents 1 kid 1 baby in stroller  many stairs making the stroller thing harder wherehow to buy tickets is not so clear and "tourist friendly" Train was VERY loaded  once we got the tickets drive was very fast much faster than Bangkok taxis

reviewTitle: Great way to see the city
reviewText: The Skytrain is fantastic It's super easy to use and trains come at regular intervals not usually more than 5mins apart At one point we got separated some could fit others couldn't but they jumped on the next train and arrived a few minutes after us  The train does get really packed at peak times and its amazing to see how many people can fit in but generally its not too bad This was our first trip to Bangkok and once we discovered the Skytrain we were able to explore the city easily We paid per trip but locals used cards which I think would be a better idea We judt didn't know how to get one but you could ask at tge station
Can get quite crowded If you're going far take a cover up as the air con is freezing Otherwise it is very easy to navigate
Ok typesit is highly hypedit's like a normal metro traincleanliness and timeliness  is there

reviewTitle: Sky train is efficient, but VERY, VERY crowded!
reviewText: We all had to stand every time we used this  difficult to board and to exit It is helpful to have a good sense of the city first Beware of the turnstiles in the terminal too as they eat tickets and it's a hassle to try to replace them

With Bangkok traffic as it is unless you are willing to venture riding on the back of a motorcyclescooter taxi your only options at certain times are the train or walking  Walking means sweatinga lot so the train is a great option It also connects to the river taxis so that gives you more nonwalking and noncar options  Some tips  You have to have change but there's a booth to get change and the machines return change The ticket machines are nicely simple though maybe not intuitive when you first use it 1) Look up your station to get fare 2) press button with that fare amount 3) Insert coined until fully paid 4) take card  You have to insert the card at the beginning and the end so hold onto it If you paid exact fare the card will not be returned to you upon exist (gate opens but no card comes back out as it did when you entered)
BTS far exceeds expectations Very well ran and very reasonable to travel around on BTS staff helpful with directions Highly recommend

reviewTitle: BTS Skytrain is good choice to travel with public transportation
reviewText: When you travel to a country or city using public transportation is an unique experience and an evidence you have been there BTS Skytrain ticket is cheap and this transportation will help you to go to the market or tourist area around Bangkok
Great service  Didn't have to wait long  Easy to use  Just wish they had elevators or escalators for those of us with bad knees  Very reliable and affordable service
Easy transport with Skytrain to and from the city centre The aircon is quite strong so take something with you if you tend to get cold
Avoid the traffic & use this Convenient mode of transport around Bangkok Ticket machines are simple to use Most signage is translated in English Affordable Clean and Efficient

Bangkok transportation is not really costly by tuktuk taximeter or bike boys service (those good people in this profession) during the less peak hours However BTS is an ideal choice for the train stops nearly every single commercial zone where there are either local markets department storesand tourist attractions This makes the travel easy for a day trip on the same route from one place to another there is also an interchange at some point to change to MRT if needed Morning and evening working hours could be packed at some stations but otherwise BTS is one of the convenient way to travel in the city

Skytrain was so easy to use Loved it Air conditioned  and a little light panel above the doors makes it easy to see your stop Just a heads up if your carrying a back pack they do a security check But to me that's just peace of mind
Easy and cheap way to travel around Bangkok Can get busy at peak times with some fairly long queues but if you avoid those times it's excellent
Its fast and a great idea but its just far to crowded for me The times i have been on you struggle to move Terrible with young childre
During our 5 days trips most of the time we took BTS and taxi cheap and convenient Choose the hotel that is near to the BTS to save time and money
Easy to get around bkk aircondition cheap travel Not hard to work out cost to be here you want to go Better than taxi It gets busy at peak times and carriage gets full Don't miss this experience

I'd you are traveling you must take the sky train For 1540 baht you can easily get around Maps are everywhere and easy to understand You find your destination and go up to the machines on the walls Select your fare depending on how many stops Put in change and there's your ticket Slide the ticket through and take it with you If you go too far or change your mind you can always pay the extra fee to the staff when you get off Always air conditioned

The best time saver in Bangkok Beats sitting in traffic It's organized clean and timely and above all affordable If you want to save time and avoid sitting in traffic during your stay in Bangkok there is no better way than to buy a day ticket or week as you wish and travel by BTS  It's convenient and most stations are linked to shopping malls and some even have a sky walk to take you to stations Save time and money Go BTS
Very easy to use Stops are in accessible locations Can be very busy at times but overall a good experience and much cheaper than getting a taxi or tuk tuk

reviewTitle: A boon to beat the traffic jam
reviewText: Always make sure you stay near BTS for convenient hassle free access to major sights in bangkok It's clean and reliable and instead of taking a cab stuck in traffic the BTS gets you to most places But if you know you are commuting during off peak hours and you have young children and shopping taking a cab is excellent too
This metro system is quite small but very effective  Its easy as a tourist to figure it out and get tickets   Lots of the info is written in english too

reviewTitle: Easy to use and faster than using taxi
reviewText: Due to traffic in Bangkok it is far much better to use the Skytrain to get around  It's cheaper and faster than taxi However it's very crowded in Skytrain
intimidating at first but very easy to use even if you don't speak the language Way faster than cab rides Bangkok has the worst traffic this skips all of that

reviewTitle: Best way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: Make no mistake  book your hotel near Skytrain station This will save you money and time when moving around It can be very crowded time to time so you might need to wait one train over but they run quite short gap

reviewText: The train itself is good but the BTS Skytrain experience is not Bangkok is extremely humid and the stations are all open air so humidity and hot weather are not a pleasant experience while waiting for trains but the train does save you from Sukhumvit traffic and saves time
Tis is a must ride when in bangkok Swift and smooth communication away from mad traffic It connects swiftly to chao praya river and hemce can be convenient to cover whole of bangkok

If you are visiting and plan to travel and visit many places I highly suggest to buy the one day pass   If you are starting in Bangkok  then get the Rabbit Card It's so fast being able cut through the long lines of people needing to buy a ticket
With Bangkoks crazy traffic the skytrain is really a convenient way to get around Not expensive either
very convenient altough a bit crowded really hope they add more route coz many place still need to ride taxi to reach and bangkok taxi is not reliable

reviewTitle: It's the easiest way to get aroind
reviewText: Bought a 100 bht travel card ( a rabbit card ) topped it up with 200 bht  each trip is about 50 bht Great way to travel to the river then catch the tourist boat to grand palace etc  also the way to get to JJ markets on the weekend

Easy to use cheap to use rapid service and a perfect way to see the city  Yes it gets busy late afternoon but other than that it's all good  We used it everyday while in Bangkok and it's clean comfortable and fast

I couldn't believe how nice and clean the Skytrain was  I've been on the subway in Los Angeles as well as New York and this train beats them both  The route isn't very long but it's still awesome

reviewTitle: Best thing that has happened to Bangkok
reviewText: The easiest cheapest and cleanest way to get around Bangkok I just wish that the entire city gets connected with this beautiful system The ticketing is easy access is super (you can get to the station from some malls without touching the street below) the service is punctual and efficient and the cleanliness is impeccable The trains are comfortable and clean The announcements are clear and co passengers are well behaved Note that the BTS can get very crowded during peak hours so avoid travelling at that time if you can Other than that this transit system scores big Well done BTS

Way of travelling in Bangkok Good value for money safe quick it fits all the needs Its a safe way to rich your destination

reviewTitle: Cheap and Safe form of Travel
reviewText: The BTS is a quick and cheap way of travelling around Bangkok  The trains are airconditioned but as with all big cities rush hour is best avoided unless you like to be up close and personal
As long as you know where you are and where you want to go it is very easy to use The names of all stations are written in Thai as well as English so it is easy for foreign travelers to follow

Convenient and regular trains but almost always crowded they could definitely do with adding a few more trains to the line Still a lot of areas in Bangkok that are inaccessible  from the train without catching a bus or taxi as well Overall much cheaper and faster than taxis
Cost of sky train ride is expensive compared to the MRT However they are the connecting points to areas of interest There is no choice but to take them
Possibly the world's best and efficient transit from airport to city at around 45 baht and you are above all the traffic

reviewTitle: The best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Bangkok streets are so crowded all of the time The BTS is cheap airconditioned and will get you to most places faster than a taxi Day passes are the way to go

the skytrain is a good way to get about but generally it doesnt get you directly from A to B Our hotel was on the river so required a boat to get to the skytrain station then the train to the weekend markets We got a taxi back which was cheaper and far easier

I come to Thailand every year with my Thai girlfriend and I have now given up on the bts system It's too hot and you can never sit as it is always to packed out Taxi or tuk tuk is more expensive but worth it

There is almost no reason not to use the BTS when you're traveling in Bangkok  The traffic is so intense sometimes a short distance would be better off walking by foot  The BTS is easy to use has clear directions and with english headings  Get yourself a Rabbit card (like the OctopusOyster cards you can find in HongKong and UK) load it with credit and off you go  However one downside is that the Rabbit card cannot be used with MRT (metro line in bangkok)  The BTS line spans across multiple key touristy areas (ie BTS Saphan Taksin to go to AsiaTique BTS Bang Wa for floating market etc) and there are key intersections where you can switch over to the MRT line to go to markets like Chatuchak  Try it out and you definitely won't regret it )
especially during the rush hours you can avoid the crazy traffic jam in Bangkok and have a unique feeling to pass Bangkok at eye level with the skyscraper

reviewTitle: A cheap & traffic free way to travel
reviewText: Used the train to go from hotel to Main shopping district though was crowded but very clean & efficient with on time arrival & departures The best part is you avoid all Bangkok traffic jams ticket prices vary by destination & start at around TB 18 & above

reviewTitle: You don't need taxis in bangkok
reviewText: BTS is the only way I commute in Bangkok unless it's a late night out and operating hours are over I dislike taking taxis here because the taxi drivers like to tout and ask for higher fare from foreigners BTS is practically linked to all the famous attractions and malls so there is really no need to take taxis I would recommend BTS for all travelers

reviewTitle: Wrap it up I'll take it.
reviewText: I don't have vast experience with the world's mass public transport systems but this one works for me Cheap and efficient If they had this in my home town (Melbourne Australia) a non user would become a user

I choose BTS a lot when travelling in Bangkok they have taxi and Tuk Tuk but for me it is not convenience since you have to bargain the price Taxi don want to use meter So BTS is a good choice for me and we could see the Bangkok city since BTS is running outside at the top of the street

We didn't use the BTS much on our trip but every experience was great Very easy to buy tickets figure out where you're going and make your way around the stations   Probably better for solo travellers as cabs and Uber are very cheap in Bangkok

Bangkok traffic is back to its 80's chaos so taxis (although incredibly cheap) are a bad option in peak times The Skytrain is an inexpensive fun and quick way to move about It will take you almost everywhere you want to go in the city

The BTS Skytrain is easy to use all you need is to know where you want to go Look on the map find the exit you need The Skytrain will take you from one point to another the only problem you will have is getting to where you will board the train from your hotel Many hotels offer complimentary shuttle service by boat or land The hotel boat's runs automatic every fifteen to thirty minutes Look for the sign that say "hotel shuttle" area  there are other taxi shuttles that will cost You need first to look at the map in order to see which train you need to take then find your exit   You ask the ticket agent for help heshe will tell you the amount you need to pay and give you change   Once you know  the amount you need to pay to your exit you go to the machine and pay that amount The agent does not sell the ticket When you have your ticket look to the sign where you train runs go through the machine by inserting the ticket on the slot and save your ticket in order to get out in your final destination If you think you get off at the wrong exit ask the guard inside before leaving This way you can still board the train without having to pay again Once you put the ticket through the exit it will not comeback out This is real easy for those used to the rail system

reviewTitle: Easy & cheap way to get around Bangkok

It is very easy to use the skytrain Even for long distances it is easy and fast comparing to the heavy traffic of Bangkok

very poor and very limited and gets very packed at the peak time from 4 to 7 pm no place to stand

reviewTitle: Easy to use and dirt cheap.

reviewTitle: Wonderful way to get around Bangkok

The system works highly efficiently and once you realise the process  usually getting change at the counters  having asked for your destination  then selecting the value of the ticket at the machine and feeding in the coins

reviewTitle: Superb time exploring bangkok on BTS
reviewText: I travelled with two older teenagers from the UK so I don't speak Thai however didn't have any problems with the language Most people spoke English  We travelled to Mo Chit to the huge weekend market and several trips to patpong Siam and central pier Very cheap and avoids the huge traffic jams in bangkok

reviewTitle: A must to get around in Bangkok!
reviewText: Bangkok traffic is almost always gridlocked  the BTS Skytrain is an excellent way to get around  There is English and Thai and it's easy to read and the announcements are in both languages as well  You are above ground so you can see the stops and where you are easily   I usually buy a Rabbit card and top it up so I don't have to buy one each time for each trip  I think there are also tourist cards available  Do wear sneakers or comfortable walking shoes as there are stairs and sometimes escalators    If you want to get to and from the airport from the city centre take the Sukhumvit line to Phayathai then get out there exit and walk to the Airport Link (you will see the sign) You need to purchase the Airport Link fare by cash (there is a ticket booth upstairs) and then take the airport link to Suwannabhumi (the name of the Airport in Bangkok)  Remember that the Airport LInk goes to Suwannabhumi Airport (international flights and some domestic flights like TG) If you are flying within Thailand pls check if it is Suwannabhumi or Don Muang that you're flying out of  If it's Don Muang it's a completely different airport   The other thing about the BTS is those red entry and exit gates move fast you need to get through them quickly or they will snap back on you and they hurt  If your body type might be too wide to pass through then there is a gate just to the right which accomodates families with children plus sized people and people with a lot of big luggage which will normally clip and be stuck through the regular entry gates    The gate to the right is manned by a guard you just give him or her your subway cards and the guard will swipe them for you and you can pass through the wider gate without time constraints   Enjoy It's the only way to get around Bangkok where you'll be on time

reviewText: We discovered the BTS sky train when we were trying to go to the Chatuchak weekend market on the Saturday we arrived in Bangkok I happened to be staying right off sukumvit road at the Amari boulevard hotel and was able to walk just about 3 blocks to find the entrance to the train  The far is very cheap and the stations are clean I do not believe that all of the stations are accommodating to those with disabilities as there are a ton of stairs to deal with  The train line we rode went straight out to mo chit where the market is and on the way back we noticed that stops were made at major shopping malls eateries and movie theaters   Air conditioning and clear announcements really make this train a great way to get around  The only down side is that the system is not sprawling and operates in a very narrow section of the city I live in NYC so I am used to a comprehensive train system but this was good for what we needed  Additionally metered taxis are so cheap so if you need to go somewhere not located off the sky train just hail a cab and make sure they use the meter don't negotiate a flat rate I promise the meter will be cheaper For example a 28kilometer ride to the airport on the meter was only 230 baht  Have fun

reviewText: Definitely the way to go  Traffic in Bangkok is pure misery  BUT if you take the skytrain during rush hour be prepared for something beyond comprehension  It made Tokyo subway look "roomy"  People were absolutely jammed together  Forget about personal space I had several rumps pushed against me with no choice  Each stop seemed to gain more people somehow though many people could not get on at all  Advice  plan to NOT travel around 6pm at all  Travel earlier (best option) or way later

reviewTitle: Best way to get around Bangkok!
reviewText: It is clean easy to use AIR CONDITIONED inexpensive The US could take some lessions from them  Highly recommend getting around on BTS  You can buy a a Rabbit card for $50 baht (non refundable) plus $50 baht refundable and load it with $100 baht  You can keep reloading the card with 100 increments or more if you want  The card will be good for 3 years if you want to keep it when you leave Bangkok for next trip  You can also use the Rabbit card in some places for food  In the food place in the lower level of Siam Paragon and other places as well  Pretty handy   All the stops are announced in English as well as Thai their app is not so great but you can get maps at the stations  They are very helpful at stations  Some have escalators some do not  SUPER easy to get to hotels from Airport using the sky link  just ask for help LOTS OF STAIRS  not wheel chair friendly

reviewTitle: The most convenient way of traveling in Bangkok
reviewText: If you have a lot to do in Bangkokbe it business pleasure shopping or diner The skytrain is the best answer for fast and most convinient way of traveling Here some tips  Buy a Rabbit card ( adult and children) makes your trips cheaper and no qeueing up at the gate Just lay the card on the sensor) After your stay you can get the guarantee (50baht) and remaining money back Initial price 200 baht Combine the BTS with the boat network on the Chao Praya river( also easy and cheap central Pier at SaphanTaksin) especially when you want to visit the Royal Palace Falang region and Flower market Trains operational until midnight It can be very cold and crowded in the train Seats are limited Qeueing is a habbit for entering the train Siam station is central between the 2 major lines Place of exchange Also the major shopping area Most stations have connection with bus taxi or tuktuk There is a special direct line to the airport (Suvarnabhumi)  accessable  via Paya Thai station 100 baht for single trip It goes fast and you can go to all major important points of interest in Bangkok

reviewTitle: An excellent way to get from Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport to downtown Bangkok
reviewText: I took the BTS Skytrain from Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport to the Nana BTS Skytrain station which is located in Sukhumvit Road and from there it was a fairly short walk to my hotel The terminal at the airport was easy to find I purchased a 'ticket' a plastic disc at the kiosk from a young lady who's English was excellent I did not have to wait long or the next train and as it is a terminus the carriages were all empty and so I had a seat I found the journey in to Bangkok interesting fast and very comfortable At the other terminus Phaya Thai BTS station I disembarked and bought another ticket for my eventual destination Nana BTS station The total cost was less than 100 Baht (¬£2) which is a lot cheaper than a taxi However that being said I do not recommend taking this journey if you have heavy or a lot of luggage or luggage and small children to look after too there are some distances to walk that include stairs and escalators

reviewText: The best way to get around Bangkok is by Sky Train It's cheap clean reliable and regular It's also far quicker cooler (AC) and more comfortable than travelling by tuk tuk Unfortunately it doesn't cover the area where the Grand Palace is situated or lot of the other ancient monuments are but between the river and most of the main shopping areas it's the only way to travel

reviewTitle: Cheap and Easy to use but doesn't go everywhere
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to move around Bangkok your first day and get a feel for things and to get to several markets specifically the huge weekend market Chatuchak Market My wife and I were in Bangkok for three days and used it heavily the first day and also paired it with the MRS (subway which is also very cheap and easy but doesn't get you everywhere) It only goes two ways and the change over stations are clearly marked simple and user friendly I recommend travel by Tuk Tuk or boat especially to see the main temples and grand palace (buy the the tourist pass and you can use the tourist boat which calls out each pier or the orange express boat)

reviewTitle: The way to get around Bangkok!
reviewText: I must say that about the majority of my scuttling about town has been on the BTS Sky train Without a doubt It will prove in many cases to be much more fast than taxis = Air conditioned and efficient For the person who is not extremely used to taking public transportation It will take a bit of adjusting to Shops and food kiosks for convenience are throughout the stations offering cell phone services to greek yogurt I would love to travel this way in Los Angeles if it were possible Minimal changes and easy transition to other lines and the bus lines make it a very doable proposition if you are willing to climb a few stairs I watched a Youtube video on the Skytrain before I came to Thailand I would recommend for others to do the same Its definitely the way to get around and be part of the fabric

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Bangkok's roads are notoriously congested so (as it is usually too hot to walk around the extensive city area) alternative transport modes such as river bus and metro are very useful There is also a really good Skytrain network extending out to the airport and as the Silom station was close to our hotel we used it quite a bit  especially to get down to the river and pick up one of the excellent local water 'buses' at Sta Sathorn The skytrains are frequent and very easy to use  carriages also air conditioned which made it nice walking in off a baking hot platform and 90% humidity Not the cheapest form of transport in Thailand but a very convenient way to get inout and about in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Not so much "attraction" as much as "transportation"
reviewText: The skytrain will get you everywhere you need to go in Bangkok Well when paired with busses and those are a little bit more complex but someone will point you in the right direction ) The only complain is that the skytrains are INCREDIBLY over airconditioned so if you have a longer ride ahead of you you might want a light sweater in your bag (as counterintuitive as that seems on a 95degree day)  Entrance to the sky train is organized you will need to get into line But when the passengers depart just keep walking and scooching in You'll be amazed how many people can fit onto this train It won't be pretty but if its rushhour there is no point in waiting for the next train because it will be just as packed If you have luggagehave fun  The booth at every station is only for change for larger bills You will need to purchase your fare card from the automated machine This is much easier than it may seem Don't be intimidated its actually easier than trying to explain where you want to go in Thai  It isn't uncommon for you to be stopped to check your bags or be asked to throw away any open drink containers Don't be surprised

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The BTS skytrain runs from through the city from the north end at the weekend market through the centre to the Central pier and another line going westeast  The trains sit high above the roads and provide good views of the city  The carriages are well air conditioned and very clean (no fooddrink)  They are sometimes packed but that is typical for large cities You can get single tickets from machines at each station  there is information on the fare required from good bilingual graphic displays  You can pay with 10 5 and 1 baht coins  the ticket desk can change notes  You can also get daytickets if you are going to hop onoff a lot   A tyical single journey is 3040 baht depending on the number of stops  The roads in Bangkok are bit crazy with traffic and often  with long jams so the BTS is a fast convenient and good value way to get around the city

reviewTitle: The easiest way to get around
reviewText: The prices are very cheap but it can also be very crowded at peak times As you travel between stations you can see the gridlock on the roads as your journey continues You can swap between different lines If you do this remember to buy your ticket at the ticket office rather than the machines The diagrams are easy to follow with stations having a letternumber disignation as well as a sometime difficult to pronounce name Although it gets crowded the people que to get on after the passengers disembark  not like a mass scrum in the UK

reviewTitle: Your one transport to get you everywhere and very efficient
reviewText: This is one of the best gifts by the government to both travelers and locals The roads with major attractions get extremely busy during evening and night and the only viable means of transportation then is BTSSkytrain Remember the basics there are two rail paths one goes from North (Mo Chit) to East (Bearing) Siam being the Central station The other goes from West (National Stadium) to South (Bang Wa) Sukhumvit is from Siam to Phra Khanong (Nana Asoke being the main touristic centers) The travel in the West to South path you have to get down on Siam and change the train Fare varies from 15 THB (adjacent stations) to 54 You'll be using 42 THB quite often Service closes at 12 am

reviewText: Living on sukhumvit this really is the only way to get around fast As I been on the skytrain almost daily for the past 3 years now there has been delays no more than twice Can be super crowded at peak hours Just wait for the next train they come within minutes Never have to wait more than 5 10 min even if you don't get on the first train I would recommend everyone to get a "Rabbit" card Pre paid tickets and also work as payment in many shops Will save you time at the station even if you are just here for a few days  Some stations are of course more busy than others Asoke is really crowded at peak hours as it connects to the underground Mrt train But I can't imagine how it used to be too travel the city before it was built Unfortunately the two lines only cover so much of the city Mrt does extend the reach but menu places still require you to take taxi or bus to get to

reviewText: A day to fill and not sure what to do  Buy a Day Ticket for the BTS (Skytrain) and travel end to end on both lines  You'll need a BTS Map and a sense of adventure  Each station has a map on the lower floor depicting places of interest close by lots to see that the usual tourist doesn't get to know about  Parks Wats Shopping Centres Museums and if you get lost there are plenty of locals willing to help with directions For a day of exploring and interest its really affordable I had great fun and lots of photographic opportunities

reviewTitle: Amazing way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: My husband and I used public transportation to get around Bangkok on a recent visit to Thailand and I highly recommend it We were so impressed by the BTS Skytrain's cleanliness politeness of other riders helpful staff and ease of "figuring out" the maps etc with only speaking English Tickets easy to access at the machines very helpful staff and the best part is you can the city from above as you travel around We took the BTS to the airport when we left the cityand found it to be extremely efficient and cost effective

reviewTitle: Generally, the best way to get around Bangkok.
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain tends to be our preferred method of travel for getting around Bangkok on most occasions Although taxis are relatively cheap in Bangkok they are of course susceptible to the horrific traffic congestion that the city is famous for A consequence of that is at certain times of day taxi drivers are reluctant to go to some destinations Quite often the simple answer is to to take the ever present and ever reliable Skytrain and if need be complete the final part of your journey by taxi  The BTS system puts the London tube to shame quite frankly It is clean air conditioned and efficient not to mention CHEAP CHEAP The service is very regular and more stations are being constructed at the moment to integrate with the MRT national rail network Already there is a service from Bangkok's international Suvarnabumi airport although I must admit we have yet to try that journey  It is easy to purchase tickets at the BTS stations through the vending machines which although often busy are quick to use (assuming everyone in the queue already knows their destination having looked at the schematic maps that are conveniently posted around the ticket machines) The useful alternative is choose and purchase a credited travelcard from the station ticketing office These can be for one day one week multiple journeys etc There is a great choice of options  If you are intending to be using the Skytrain on and off over a long period the "BTS Sky Smartpass" is a useful option It can be topped up whenever necessary and cashed in on completion (as the credit amount doesn't expire) and it is a quick "touch and pass" entrance at the barriers  Getting to where you want to go is simple Once you are through the barriers there are station maps posted directly in front of you so that you can confirm which platform the go to (depending on which direction you wish to travel and at some of the connecting stations which BTS line you wish to take) On the trains above the doors there are station maps that are illuminated and pinpoint where you are during your journey as well as next station announcements   Access is possible for wheelchairs onto the trains and most if not all stations have lift access as well as the normal escalatorsWhen the system is busy there is a remarkably ordered manner for embarking the trains On the platforms queues form either side of where the train's doors will stop as marked on the platform and disembarking passengers are courteously allowed off before others embark   The Skytrain is a very efficient cheap and reliable service that the Thai people are quite rightly proud of and it is used by many as a routine method of travel I always find it a pleasure to use

reviewTitle: The Good, the bad and the ugly
reviewText: I am a longtime resident of Bangkok The BTS system known as the Skytrain is  like many things in Thailand  a good idea poorly executed It is most certainly a very fast way of getting around some areas of Bangkok but there are just two lines and there are vast areas of the city that is doesn't cover or even go near It is cheap to use but if you are a casual user and do not need a stored value ticket (like London's curiously named Oyster Card) you come up against the bizarre practise that the locals probably understand but others do not There are machines that dispense tickets but with most you need change So you have to queue at a window where an always polite employee will give you that change Then you queue again at a machine and buy the ticket easy with the fare chart showing the fare to each station The always polite staff who give you the change will also sell you a stored value or daily ticket but not sell you a single ride ticket As I say this probably makes perfect sense to the Thais but baffles everyone else So far so good The bad is that the system is grossly overcrowded often even outside of the rush hours and it is not unusual to have to let one or more trains go before you can squeeze on board The good here is that the longest wait between trains is five minutes and because the system is small the journey time for most is rarely more than 15 minutes or so Why it is so crowded is because the trains are far shorter than the platforms They have recently expanded from three car to four car trains but for 500000 riders a day that is absurd compared to other major cities round the world that have eight or 12 cars When it was built like the airport there was absolutely no thought given to how many would use it The ugly is that like in much of Thailand the company operates a racist pricing system Over 60s can get a discounted ticket outside of the rush hours but only if they are Thai The similar underground railway system allows anyone the discounted fare regardless of race I invited the BTS to explain and justify their policy but alI I received was a stony and predictable silence

Getting around Bangkok on the Sky train is the only way to go It is very clean gets you to most of the attractions with trains every few minutes You can buy a day pass for 130 baht which gives you unlimited travel until 1200 pm excellent value Taxis are very cheap but the traffic is unbelievable Staff are all very helpful advising which station to get off at or openning barriers when carrying luggage Also very good for getting to either of the airports with connections either by airport link for Suvarnabhumi  or bus from Mo Chit for Don Muang Airport

reviewTitle: Reliable, cheap, clean and easy to use.
reviewText: I live in Bangkok and use the BTS every day It is easy to use and navigate cheap clean and reliable Just look at the boards next to the ticket machines to see your current location where you need to get to and the required fare Either use coins in the ticket machine or go to the kiosk to buy your ticket then through the turnstyles and you're on your way  You can buy passestravel cards rather than individual tickets but there's no cost savings so I don't bother I nearly always have change for the machine and the queues for tickets (when applicable) are never too long  During busy times and when it's raining the BTS is usually quicker than taxis or tuk tuks providing of course that your destination is on one of the main routes If you're a tourists or on a shopping trip then it probably will be
not only the fastest and cheapest way to get across the city its also a great way to see the city the train its self and all the stations are just so clean and immaculate

Our retirement home is Bangkok Though we own a car the Skytrain is a blessing to avoid traffic in peak times and key business areas It's clean dependable and very affordable The new overhead walkway linkages to department stores malls hotels and major buildings also make life more pleasant and allows us to breathe less polluted air and avoid the human congestion (normal on Bangkok busy streets) The signage is clearly marked staff are helpful and they will even open a gate for you if you have a stroller or a large bag   It has also helped reduce some traffic congestion so we also benefit even when we drive )

I visit Bangkok almost every month by car First thing I do park the car at the hotel and just leave it there until the day I am leaving Bangkok Using the Skytrain is the way to conquer this vibrant raucous untamed city it's easy to find your way even for a first time visitor There are times when the stations and the trains get pretty crowded but Thais in generell are disciplined and courteous when using the Skytrain unfortunately this does not apply when they are driving a bike or a car The trains are extremely clean no graffitis no garbage air conditioned and comfortable

reviewTitle: A pleasant use in an otherwise congested city.
reviewText: The Skytrain is hands down the fastest and most convenient way to travel around Bangkok We very quickly learned that taking a taxi or Tuk Tuk from anywhere along Sukumvit Rd ended in gridlock The Skytrain bypasses all that and proved to be a very efficient and reliable means of transpo Upon our departure to the international airport we took the Skytrain directly to the terminal a far cheaper and relaxing ride than a taxi

reviewTitle: A Hop On Hop Off Sightseeing of Bangkok
reviewText: Whether you have a full day or few hours the Bangkok Transit System or commonly known as the BTS can be a perfect choice to see the city  The BTS crossed in Siam Square where the Paragon Department Store is located and span across the Sukhumvit Road all the way to the JJ Market in one line also starts from MBK Mall to Sathorn Road across the Chao Phya River  Best to choose the route near your hotel and enjoy the sight and sound of Bangkok  The BTS starts sometime around 600 am however anytime after 900 am would be a good time to venture around town with BTS without having to fight for standing space on the sky train  There are few stops that are worthwhile to spend time in walking around eg Siam Square Saladaeng Asoke Taksing Bridge and the JJ Market  Before boarding check whether they have any promotion rate for tourist for that day  Even if you pay full price the experience is worth the cost of the ride  You may buy a ticket that allow you to hop on and hop off without having to buy new ticket which can be irritating

Fast efficient (sometimes crowded) however very convenient with stations at strategic spots around town Make sure you have coins and deciphering the ticket advice can be interesting when determining where you want to go

We found the skytrain in combination with Bangkok's underground the best way to move around that city Skytrain stations are at the most important areas that one needs  it is inexpensive and ticketing machines & advice simple to understandApart from an internal map inside the train showing where you are each station is announced well ahead of time

The Skytrain allows you to plan meetings and arrive on time without hassle The system works efficiently is clean is safe and is well located for so much of Bangkok's business centres Buy a pass to save lining up for tickets and watch the fast closing gates as you walk through the gates Read the maps so you take the correct exit as the walkways can get you to most buildings in sheltered comfort Peak hour can be busy

A frequent and efficient way to get around and it covers the shopping and entertainmant areas of Silom (Sala Daeng) Siam Square and all the way along Sukhumvit Road the weekend market is at Mo Chit but you are better off using the MRT for this and getting off at Kamphaeng Phet which is right inside the market It is incredible to think that this has been in operation for more than 10 years  still so clean wellmaintained and graffittifree It is quite busy all of the day and probably should be avoided at rush hours Tickets are only available from coinoperated machines but the cashiers will give you change if you do not have the right coins  and currently the machines do not accept 2 baht coins The interchange station at Siam is very busy with queues to get on the escalators but its not too bad A bit expensive by Thai standards but should be within the budget of most travellers Tickets are not valid on the MRT (underground) and separate tickets have to be bought for this

It's a very convenient way to travel around Bangkok for tourists There are some tips you should be aware of 1 There are 2 main lines the National Stadium line and the Sukhumvit line Each runs both ways They intersect at "Siam station" If you're not sure where you are just go to that station and start over You're not going to be charged extra as long as you don't get out from the BTS area (I mean returning the ticket) 2 If you are unaccustomed with the ticket machine you can just go to the ticket counter and ask for a ticket directly 3 Beware of the rush hours Bangkok may not be as crowded as Tokyo but it's not far behind 4 They are building new stations at the moment So There might be some station names that you've never heard of and don't know where they lead to It's a little confusing if you ask me Just don't panic and you'll be fine Besides Thai students are always around the BTS (In uniform) Most of them speak English well and you can always ask for direction )

reviewTitle: I am a resident here in Thailand and Lived in Bangkok for 7 years. Now I live in the NorthEast province of Ubon Ratchath
reviewText: The Sky train is a the local city transport system and they also have the underground called the MRT Both services pretty much covers Bangkok Very easy to get around in  Its better to use this service than taxi or bus because the traffic is horrendous in the city Reading the train map and connections is very easy The staff at the stations are very help this also includes the security guards who are all eager to help with a smile    The trains fares vary from destination to destination and all electronic ticket style card machines are in English as well You just cannot get lost The train system is not as big as London or New York but it serves Bangkok well  As mentioned I am a full time resident here in Thailand so the dates that has been mentioned  is incorrect because that's how far the tripadvisor goes back to August 2012 I have been here since February 2004

reviewTitle: Takes you where you need to go
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is a great form of public transportation to get to and fro around Bangkok  The trains stop at most major areas are are either right where you need to go or only a block or 2 away  Very clean and very affordable  Get a 1 day pass with unlimited rides  The kiosks and machines can be a little confusing to the first timers  There is security always around to keep things safe at all hours of the day and night  The same goes for the MRT (subway)  The BTS stations all have little shops and places to get snacks and drinks  Many even have restrooms and camera shops travel agents etc

I was very impressed with the skytrain on our last visit to Bangkok  The trains are punctual clean and nice and cool due to the air conditioning inside  I was surprised to step out of the intense heat and into cooled comfort  The train stops along all of the major parks and shopping areas and is very convenient if you are staying in central Bangkok    I was traveling with an 18 month old on the last trip and had a strollerbuggy which wasn't the greatest for maneuvering around the city anyway but I found that many of the stops had elevators although these could be difficult to find at times

reviewTitle: A Blessing to First Time BKK Visitors
reviewText: Did plenty of research online before visiting Bangkok for the first time and because I & my companions were traveling independently it was a blessing to have the BTS easily accessible from the hostel we stayed in (Lub D Siam Square)  I was able to plan our entire 4day itinerary by building it around the BTS stations that were were gonna get off of (or take train transfers from)    The two BTS lines (Silom & Sukhumvit) are also interconnected with the MRT subway system and the boat station transfers are pretty seamless so we were able to pretty much do the very touristy things that any first time visitor is bound to do by simply taking public transport without having to deal with Bangkok's monstrous traffic jams  If you plan to use the BTS in the span of 1 day do get the 1day pass to save up on fare (unlimited rides for 1 day)  The BTS only operates until midnight so if your flight is coming in later than that you have no choice but to take a cab (which we did) or a bus to get to your hotel for our departure we were able to travel from our hostel to the airport via BTS and the Airport Rail Line (interchanged at Phaya Thai station) and travel was a breeze took us a mere 45 mins and saved us a few hundred bahts

Convenient fast and able to get to most locations without a traffic jam try the BTS Even for the new traveller this network is easy to navigate and has both English and Thai explanation at ticket machines or staff on standby to help with change or information

reviewTitle: Excellent way of beating the traffic
reviewText: Skytrain's got to be one of the better public transit systems in the region if not the world The trains are very clean and the Thais certainly know their public transport manners very well The tickets are also very reasonablypriced but during offpeak hours when traffic's a little smoother taking a cab might be a cheaper option of getting around town The system also covers a large area of Bangkok and a good number (but not all) of popular tourist attractions in the city  BTS is great but one thing I wish they could improve on only some of the stations are equipped with escalators it'd be nice if they provided them at all their stations An extension is also overdue another line or two wouldn't hurt really considering that many parts of Bangkok are still beyond the reach of its mass transit systems (MRT & BTS)

reviewTitle: The sky is the place to be
reviewText: Arrived in bangkok and got a taxi to Thanon Suhkumvit where my hotel was The taxi trip was hell Gridlocked traffic was crazy I looked overhead to see the Bts skytrain going past Got to my hotel dropped off my luggage and proceeded to explore Got to the Asoke Bts station Working out where to buy a ticket and how much was very easy as there are a lot of posters showing you If you get confused you can always ask a guard or the information booth people (who also changed your notes to coins as the ticket machines only take coins) The trains themselves are fully air conditioned and was a welcome relief from the humid bangkok weather The station stops are broadcast in the train in both thai and English so there is no chance to miss your station If you travel during rush hours (Work and school times) then be prepared for a tight squeeze I travelled sometimes during the rush It's an adventure seeing how many more people can squeeze into an already packed train Reminds me of the mini car with all the dwarfs in it Packed in like sardines Still an enjoyable experience as the thai people are so laid back and relaxed   Tldr use the skytrain to beat the traffic but be prepared for the squeeze during peak hours

reviewText: There's no doubt that the traffic in BKK will get you down But everything changes when you get to the Skytrain The problem for casual Skytrain users is that each time you take a new journey you have to buy a ticket Apart from waiting in long queues this requires having the right coins in your pocket or another trip to the change office The simplest way to travel is to get the Skytrain Pass for easy progress through the ticket lines (The Skytrain Pass has recently changed to become the Rabbit Pass) The pass will save you lots of time in the queues and can be used in other outlets too  Purchase the Rabbit at the Change Office for 200 baht with 150 baht credit (this is an introductory price so be cool with any changes after 31December 2012)

Unless you happen to be going from very close to one of the stations to another location very close to another station (which is quite unlikely given that the network is currently limited) it probably makes more sense to take a taxi  Given the heat and humidity in Bangkok you will not want to walk far so you generally need to take a taxi then the skytrain then another taxi to reach your destination which is more generally more costly than taking one taxi (the Bangkok taxi pricing scheme is set such that they get a decent set fee per journey but then the meter goes up very slowly for distance)  Also it generally takes the same time as just taking one taxi This is because finding a taxi can take a long time in Bangkok so having to find 2 taxis rather than one is not advisable The exception is when it is rush hour (when traffic jams block all the main roads) but at this time the skytrain is so busy as to be an absolutely awful experience  As I say it is ok for commuters who have (intentionally bought an apartment next to a station and work in an office next to another station) but for general trips around the city I find taxis to be much better  The only positive is that (when it is not busy) the carriages are actually quite pleasant and if in the future they massively expand the network it could be a good alternative to taxis

reviewTitle: The best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: I moved to Bangkok 8 months ago In previous visits to research where I wanted to live I quickly realized that while taxis are inexpensive the rides can prove very frustrating Bangkok has some of the most frequent and worst traffic jams in the world However the BTS (elevated train system) and the MRT (subway system) are clean efficient air conditioned and easy to use I rented a condo near the Asok BTS station and Sukhumvit MRT station I use these systems daily They are inexpensive run frequently  sometimes at peak travel times trains run every 25 minutes You can either buy tickets from machines for individual trips or reloadable cards from the ticket windows I recommend the cards as the ticket lines can sometimes be long I always reload the cards when I notice lines at a particular station are short or nonexistant Unfortunately you need separate cards for each system but it's a minor inconvenience The trains and subways can be very crowded at peak times 910 AM &  48 PM on weekdays depending on the direction you are going I have always found both systems to be reliable and safe I've had no experiences with myself or anyone I heard of having trouble with pickpockets or thieves But you should always be alert to those possibilities when traveling in crowded situations The BTS website is informative and easy to navigate

I prefer to use bts because it shortens human time and it is fast and provides excellent service to all people and I always advise my friends to use it and I should mention that the prices of mobility are not expensive

reviewTitle: Well co-ordinated life line of the city. Very crowded in office hours.
reviewText: The trains move within restricted routes of the city One called the Sukhumvit line and the other Silom line The changeover is at Siam Most of the stations are interconnected to nearby shopping malls and hotels thus making it convenient to use in inclement weather Also there are bike taxis which operate from the inner lanes to the BTS station making it a smooth and fast journey There are certain stations like Asoke (Sukhumvit Line)  and Sala Daeng (Silom Line) which are connected to the underground MRT Paya Thai BTS is connected to the Airport Rail Link connecting the city to Suvarnabhumi Airport

I always use the sky train when I land in Bangkok it's really convenient and fast aswell as an extremely affordable way to get into Bangkok CBD I would recommend this over taking a taxi or a cab unless you have a very large budget the taxis and cabs tend to charge ridiculous prices and because bangkok is so busy it takes way longer aswell  Along with everything being written in Thai there is also English writing underneath it so it's easy to understand where you are and where you need to get off
I was staying in the downtown of Bangkok Thailand the BTS we called it SKY train can reach to everywhere in the shopping area Just a bit crowded

reviewTitle: Just a useful way to get around
reviewText: It's cheap and easy  What's not to love especially if you avoid rush hour  Also connects with other transport links
Very reliable fast and affordable Although changing noted to coins can be long it helps one to avoid the jam on the busy roads of bkk

reviewTitle: A great way to get around bangkok
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok The stations are easy to get around well sign posted with all the revelant information This was our main mode of transport We purchased a BTS One Day Pass which allowed us to use the system all day long & was cheaper than single tickets We went up to Mo Chit on Sunday & walked to the big weekend markets We stayed near Phaya Thai station & Siam was only two stops away all the large shops Also changed lines & went down to the river Great transport system wish ours was  as good in Australia
Best way to move in place to place in Bangkok I recommend to book hotel near to skytrain stations It's cheap too

reviewTitle: Stay close to the BTS and you'll be fine!
reviewText: The best way of transportation in Bangkok without a doubt I always ensure to book hotels close to the BTS whenever visiting Bangkok Also combining transportation with a taxi app like Uber or Grab can really enhance your stay in BKK I don't enjoy the energy consuming task of negotiating about taxi meter vs fixed prices The only negative aspect about the BTS is that it can be quite expensive after several trips in one day which is not unusual

reviewTitle: You have to try the BTS.
reviewText: I passed on commuting the BTS on previous trips This time it was a must given the traffic and our destination (Erawan)  Quite the experience  Heads up  don't cross the yellow line or the security will start blowing whistles and yelling at you in Thai  lol
I am not sure about the service is good or just like average but this facilities was help me a lot to move (in BKK)

reviewTitle: Excellent way to move around the city.
reviewText: This is the best way to move around the city and avoid traffic It is like any developed country metro but on top of the city Sometimes it gets very crowded but that is not different from the rest of the world

Want to get around we without being stuck in the Bangkok traffic for a fraction of the price Take the train Clean fast and efficient  If you dont mind a bit of cultural experience and see how the locals travel go for it Easy access to getting around the city the trains are air conditioned and get you around in a jiffy Do be mindful of peak times as the trains can get crowded The ticket counters and signage is clearly marked in English so any traveller will not get confused  There are not many people who are very familiar with English and asking around may be a hit and a miss so make sure you have a map and can point to people where you want to go  Crowded trains can be a haven for pick pockets so be sensibly cautious of your belongings and your wallet I had a very positive experience but it doesn't harm to be a sensible traveller and take home positive memories of this tantalizing country called Thailand  Bon Voyage and safe travels

Great way to travel around Bangkok We used this a few times during our stay Easy to navigate and value for money Really good for getting to Eastern Bus terminal and Mo Chit Nicely air conditioned and great to see the city from above  If getting to it from the River Taxis  get off at Central Pier you can walk to the sky train from there

Sky train was great Cheap and efficient As foreigners we found it a bit confusing to start with and were unsure where to wait for train but we soon got the hang of it  Highly patronised so even during what we considered off peak there was standing room only Would recommend you plan your journey before leaving home so you know what to ask for and which direction you need to be going in  Overall a fun experience that got us where we wanted to go

I use this every time I am in Bangkok Not only is it cheap but it is clean on time and SAFE The destination boards are easy to read and if you do have problems with the ticketing machines the staff are only too happy to assist It is much better to be above the traffic than stuck in it

reviewTitle: Easy Smooth Comfortable and cheap transport

Used this recently and was really impressed with it's efficiency Trains are fast frequent and comfortable Great way to get around d the city
The BTS is easy and cheap to navigate and we used it to get around everywhere we needed to go in Bangkok

the bts was about 10 min walk from my hotel and this is still the quickest way to get around the city especially if you are visiting the malls as they are connected We took this to siam paragon which was great Not family friendly but for a short trip this was OK

reviewTitle: Great transport link across the city.
reviewText: This transport link is air conditioned and offers easy and cheap transport to many of the top sites in the city  It can get very busy around 5pm and early in the morning  Trains are very frequent

reviewTitle: Best way to avoid Bangkok traffic
reviewText: We stayed at a hotel in Sukhumvit area and BTS was our main transport due to traffic Try to avoid using BTS between 700900 and 17001900 during weekdays if u can because it is overcrowded  If u wanna go to MBK or Siam Paragon shopping mall from Suvarnabhumi Airport u could use Airport Link to Phraya Thai then BTS to Siam station  If u wanna go to Terminal 21 shopping mall from the airport u could use Airport Link to Makkasan then use MRT (underground) from Petchaburi to Sukhumvit station  Food & drinks are not allowed on BTS All areas were kept tidy and clean at all times Staff were helpful and informative   It is very convenient to travel around Bangkok but not for disabled users as there is no facilities for them at most of BTS stations

Easy to navigate transport system And if you get lost there is always a friendly Thai person around to help you The BTS is air conditioned which is great Takes you to great locations around Bangkok and is quicker cheaper and better than sitting in a taxi

reviewTitle: Great way to get around the traffic

BTS Sky Train Easy to come and good experience the connect of a part major  of Bangkok it's quicker and cheaper

The skytrain did at first seem a wee bit daunting but once one is on it getting around us easy The stations are well sign posted and the trains are clean Everything runs quite efficiently
Sky train offers a convenient way of traveling in all areas of Bangkok Try to get Daily pass as its cheap

modern  fast convenient  cheap way of travel in congested bangkok  and even to the airport it goes  must try
BTS is cheap Easy to purchase ticket It goes places where mrt does not go Since it is a monorail you can see outside

reviewTitle: Just a great way to get around
reviewText: It might seem odd to rate a mass transit system  which is actually what the BTS Skytrain is  but it is a great way to get around the newer parts of the city and absolutely the best way to avoid Bangkok's horrendous traffic  Its clean quick and air conditioned  It links to the underground system (also a great way to get around) so much of the wider city is very easy to get to around  The down side is that the BTS Skytrain does not get you to the big tourist areas down at the riverside (The Royal Palace etc) but you can get close enough to the river to be able to walk to one of the quay side taxi places for a river taxi

reviewText: BTS Skytrains are very well connected across the city It is the best way to travel around in Bangkok Though it's crowded during the peak hours it is still better as you can avoid the heavy road traffic if you are on a budget trip then this is the best pick and its convenient as well There are trains almost every 510 mins and it's a huge time saver on a jam packed trip compared to the taxis or tuktuks

Cheap easy to use and takes you to different locations Downside   can be very very busy   Staff are helpful and work out for you the different stops you need for your journey

The BTS is generally clean and efficient service but ticketing could be far better Most stations have a couple of old ticket machines and at peak times long queues can form More ticket machines would be useful The customer service booth only seems to be able to offer day tickets and change (old ticket machines only accept coins) I enquired about a day pass which in the end wasn't desirable for my needs I later found out about the rabbit card  a top up card you can keep for years The customer service agent despite having a good command of English didn't mention this option to me at all It would have been useful   More ticket machines would be great and all machines modernised to accept cash or insert a change machine rather than having to queue to see the agent just to get coins would be useful  Signage could also be improved  with the boards detailing the stops placed clearly at the bottom of each set of stairs up to the train platform

reviewTitle: Efficient way to beat the Bangkok traffic
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is the elevated train in Bangkok which has two main lines The service is very efficient with trains running at quick intervals especially at peak times A very handy way to get around parts of the city and also tourist friendly Either single trip or stored value cards are available
The BTS is very reliable clean cheap and has air conditioning in all trains Best way to get around Bangkok They also have shops in some BTS stations

This is the quickest way of transportation in Bangkok Not very crowded and price reasonable Better buy a stored  value tickets if travel a lot around Otherwise getting a single journey ticket is easy But better prepare enough coins when taking BTS in peak hours because you have to line up for coins and line up for tickets
Very quick and easy to use Clean cheap and efficient No need to use city taxis for airport transfers

It was an amazing initiative of Bangkok to introduce the BTS System and it is now quite popular with every tourist I dare say  Staff are typically very helpful and there are machines as well  The fares are affordable but the annual increase stands in no relationship with the quality of service because trains are overloaded now during peak hours  Safety In recent years security gates have been installed and G4S guards have not been replaced by those In fact BTS have now got a security officer at every exit on some of the station Quite an intrusion into your privacy since they expect you to open your bags publicly  and they then do not really inspect anything  a bit pointless  The security at the platform and on the sky walk are mostly unreasonable For example taking photographs is an issue as they push you to move on  although there might be 20m wide and 500m long strips with not a single person in sight I am not sure why security officers would engage when there is no 'security concern' nor 'risk'  I am still enjoying my journeys and I hope you like my images
BTS is the beat option to travel in Bangkok  U save time to stuck in traffic with BTS  anyway the cab will be better option at night as rate will be cheaper sometime and no traffic

Clean and proper cheap and convenientthat's what I can describe about this wonderful means of transportation in Bangkok
Very impressed with BTS system and quality of service and trains  Easy to use  Very efficient and lots of lovely Thai ladies to brighten the day with their lovely smiles

Avoid the traffic dodgy tuk tuk and taxi drivers and just get the BTS and walk a little to your destination The BTS are a comfortable temperature even when crowded and you have to stand for a little while
if your destination is on one of the two lines you're in luck comfortable and easy to get too and you avoid all the busy roads

reviewTitle: Skytrain is THE way to get around in Bangkok!!

It is not developed for wheelchair or kids trolley as there is no elevators Crowded but easy to use and I advise to use them to avoid the traffic jams

If you destinationsite is close to a BTS station then definitely take the BTS It's comfortable air conditioned and cheap  Definitely get the 1day unlimited pass (available as of this writing) if you'll be taking the BTS four times or more in one day Tickets can be purchased from the machines or booths (which tend to be quicker regardless of time of day)  How to use at the gates Insert your ticket wait a second then retrieve it when it pops out Now walk through the gate When exiting insert your ticket (the gate will keep it on your exit) and walk through the gate  Major downside of the BTS Trains run between 1015 minutes apart If you miss one it can feel like a very long wait in the Bangkok heat and humidity
It's very clean quick and simple to take The train goes to the main places of the city Not expensive

Cheap and great medium to go places in Bangkok The trains are clean and well maintained You need to first get change in coins and then take tickets using automated machines Being an outsider it wasn't difficult to figure out things They have made it very tourist friendly
The train can reach most of the popular shopping malls The fare is reasonable However do avoid peak period as it will get quite crowded

Clean efficient and cheap There really isn't much more I can say about it By far the best way to get about the city

reviewTitle: Easiest way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: Great experience easy to navigateticket machines on the station and cashiers who speak English   Prices very reasonable  At certain times peak office time it can be quite compact on the train however is a million times better than being stuck in the sea of a moving car park on all the roads below  It took 3 and a half hours stuck in the back of a taxi that I later learnt could have been travelled by BTS in 30 minutes at a fraction of the price    Check it out is definitely the fastest cleanest and a cheap way to travel

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Definitely recommend the skytrain if you're traveling in town Not too expensive lots of places to stop on and off and the staff is very helpful if you aren't sure what you're doing

reviewTitle: Best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: With the infamous traffic jams in Bangkok the BTS is the best way to get around in Bangkok with the next best alternative being motorbike (only 15 to 45THB per ride) or tuk tuk (bargain) for the adventurous

reviewTitle: The fastest way to get around Bangkok and miss the traffic jams.
reviewText: The BTS [SKYWAY] can get you quickly efficiently and cheaply to just about anywhere you want to go plus it has stations that interchange with both the MRT [underground] and the Suvamabhumi Airport Link For shopping we would get off at National Stadium for MBK centre and Siam Square1 and short walk to Siam Centre and Siam Paragon and the board at BTS Siam to travel back to our hotel at Sala Daeng On the weekend we took the BTS to Chatuchak market which is a short walk from BTS Mo Chit For our visit to the Grand Palace we took BTS to Saphan Taksin station then a short walk to Sathorn Pier and caught a ferry All the station exit signage is really clear and easy to follow this is the BEST way to get around Bangkok

reviewTitle: smooth trip and easy to use
reviewText: Much easier to use the BTS Skytrain to transfer tofrom your hotel than taking a taxi as it's quicker and cheaper

reviewTitle: The BTS in Bkk saves you time!
reviewText: In BKK traveling around during the day in a taxi takes forever and in summer it's just got to walk around anywhere It can be 15 mins on the BTS vs 90 mins in a taxi during peak traffic The BTS or subway is the best way of moving around It's affordable clean safe air conditioned and convenient   The Thai people are one of the most polite people in the world and you notice it on the BTS I suggest you go ahead and get what they call a rabbit card which is a prepaid card for 500 to 1000 Thai Bhatt instead of waiting inline every time to get coins and then buy tickets The rabbit card can also be used to buy things at food courts etc  You can also use the BTS to go to the airport  but make sure your suit case has some good wheels on it The only draw back to the BTS is that at many places there are no escalators so you have to walk up and downstairs which isn't easy when you have young kids or heavy bags with you I suggest when choosing a hotel you chose one connected to the BTS or else really close

reviewTitle: Best way to go around the city
reviewText: With usual traffic jam in the city BTS skytrain in the most convenient way to roam around the city  It passes thru most famous shopping centers in the city

BTS skytrain is a very comfortable way to travel around in Bangkok  It's quick runs frequently and its air conditioned And if you don't have too much luggage you can even take it from the new airport Just get away from the rush traffic that can take hours into the city  The weakness of BTS is that it only runs 2 lines  which mean that you might need to take a taxi after you get close to your endpoint but you might have saved a lot of time during the main part of you trip
probably you know how overcrowded is BKK taking taxi is not an option as you will sitting hours in the traffic Skytrain is well air conditioned fast and good value for money don't think just take
