reviewTitle: Good and Affordable Way To Travel Around
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is a good way to travel around in BKK and very affordable It is very convenient too Although to get to Pratunam area one would still need to alight at Chit Lom or Siam station and walk   The walk there has been made an even better experience with the building of the RLink a linkway that connects the station all way through to Platinum Mall in Pratunam  It is usually crowded but getting on and to your destination should be a breeze

The BTS is an absolute must if you plan on traveling around Bangkok  Not only will it keep you off the busy city streets  but it is a clean and enjoyable way to do what the natives do  Thousands of Bangkokians travel via the BTS everyday and it is understandable why The cars are clean  the facilities are in great shape  and things are always running on time  My family love getting onto the BTS anytime we want to go to the mall or one of the many city landmarks  If you are in Bangkok and haven't done so  try the BTS you will love it

Skytrain IS the way to get around Bangkok clean well run efficient and that great aircon Buy a day pass for better value and take unlimited trips You can get to most tourist attractions this way including Chatuchuk Market on the weekends SkyTrain also connects to the Airport Express which means you can get from the airport to the City and close to most hotels on the SkyTrain route for around BAHT130 (AUD5)

My friend and I caught the sky train out to the Chatuchak Markets in Mo Chit  from the Surasak station  we had to change trains at the Siam Station  Before boarding the train you have to buy tokens that let you through the turn style There is a map showing the stations and how much money you need to get the tokens required There is also information offices to buy change from if you don't have the correct money and need help  We had to change trains at Siam Station which was a piece of cake The trains are pretty full but people are very respectful vacating seats for elderly and parents with children I found the whole experience hassle free and very easy The trains are clean and fast The frequency of the train schedule is every 4 minutes I believe And it was cheap it cost us 42 baht each for a one way journey I would definitely recommend BTS sky train travel

After so many times visit Thailand this was the first time I used the BTS almost everyday Very cheap and fast comphare to taxi Avoid the rush hours otherwise you will hv to queue and it will be so crowded inside the train But it was still fun

reviewTitle: Affordable, easy to navigate, and convenient!
reviewText: I enjoy public transportation when in a new city being very familiar with DC NYC Boston and Los Angeles as well as London Paris Barcelona Madrid and others  As a firsttime visitor to Southeast Asia traveling alone I decided to try to master the public rail system on the first day and found it to be easy to navigate  Advice  if you are going to make more than 2 stops each way in a day always buy the 1day pass  In July 2017 it is 140 baht (less than $5)  With most trips being 2545 baht you quickly save money  But even on lower travel days the time saved of having to buy individual passes (first waiting in light to get change before getting in the line to buy the individual ticket) is worth the extra cost  I stayed in a hotel just off of Sukhumvit and found that to be a great location  easy access to many malls the Bangkok Arts & Culture Center the Jim Thompson House and Outlet Store weekend farmers markets and the Chatuchak Weekend Market  And even in going to places not on the BTS many connections were doable  I went to the Grand Palace and Wat Po by 2 trains and a ferry in going to a night market one night and a rooftop restaurant another it was an easy transfer to the MRT (although the two systems of passes are entirely different  one uses a coded card and the MRT uses a wooden token)  Sometimes the trains are VERY crowded but the status changes stop by stop And while people are pressed together occasionally there is no pushing or stress just crowding    I used the BTS system for a week in the heat of July and found the trains to always be well air conditioned  And the queuing system (platforms are marked with two rows of angled access from each side of each train door opening with a large exit area for deboarding) is the best I've seen anyplace in the world  Recommendations for improvement  merge the passtoken systems for BTS and MRT make it easier to buy multiple passes at the same time (both for going and coming as well as buying for 2 or more people traveling together) and make train maps more readily available  I picked one up at the airport information center and learned later that it was not replaceable at BTS stations  Advice  The specific Google Maps app on your smart phone allows you to plan trips using the Bangkok public transportation system (one trip at a time) whereas the Google maps app that is standard on an iPhone does not  It was great to have it for walking from a train stop to the location as it could track where you are and let you know if you're going the right direction (since I couldn't read Thai this was very helpful)

The BTS is the easiest and best way to get around Bangkok considering the traffic situation in the city   The rabbit card is the only way to go  saves a tremendous amount of time and makes it so much easier   Every station  I have been to has a major design flaw   The BTS planners have never heard of traffic flow planning   Putting the cashiers right adjacent to the entry gates and then the ticket machines just opposite causes a huge coagulation of people all right in front of the turnstiles   If it was laid out linear instead  with cashier away from the main turnstiles then the ticket machines placed off to the sides on the way to the turnstiles it would stop the congestion and make it easier for people to navigate   Very poor planning  The trains are clean and cool inside   More trains are needed overall to reduce wait time and over crowding   Maybe putting in a few more escalators would be nice and having easy access to the to few elevators would also be a big improvement   Like many things in Thailand it was a great idea but fell short in the little details that would make it a much more pleasant experience

reviewTitle: It's a means of transport...and cooling!
reviewText: The Skytrain in Bangkok known as the BTS is a great way to get around town Unless you're willing to take a motorcycle taxi (with the attendant risks) BTS is really the fastest way to get from one place to another A good combo is to take the BTS to as near as you can get to a place you're going and then walk or take a taxi from there The cost is minimal and you get where you're going fast An added bonus is the air conditioning which is really strongvery nice if you're just coming out of the Bangkok heat   The BTS is matched with the underground train the MRT and they meet relatively closely at several points including an almost direct transfer at Asok BTSSukhumvit MRT One down side of the BTS is that it is very popular and can often be quite crowded Interestingly as some forms of public transportation in Bangkok are very low cost or free like the red buses this means that taking BTS is something of a higher class activity In Bangkok the upper set takes the BTS if it wants to not sit in traffic especially the younger crowd who don't have the ability to drive as yet You'll also notice that there are comparatively a lot of foreigners taking the BTS There are a lot of languages being spoken in Bangkok's most famous airconditioning location  BTS is not undergoing a massive expansion I believe parts of this are due to open in 2017 with the whole system expanded by something like 2020 This includes lines that go into the main royal areas of Bangkok Chinatown and include a loop through the west side of the Chao Phraya River a very little known part of Bangkok aside from Wat Arun which is currently quite difficult to get to This expansion will make the BTS a real force for public transport across the city akin in some ways to the Underground in London MRT in Singapore etc Suffice it to say that when the BTS expansion opens Bangkok will be an even better place to visit that it already is

Our stay in Bangkok was helped greatly by the skytrain Our hotel Eastin Grand Sathorn has its very own stop that connects to the skytrain We used the skytrain to go to the Chatuchak Market Mo Chit station (@48 baht) and a few restaurants and shopping centers     This was a wonderful way to avoid the horrid Bangkok traffic and the hideous taxi drivers The skytrain is very efficient There are attendants at kiosks there to give you change and buy your ticket Most spoke english and we never had issues buying tickets Once you have a ticket you go through the turnsyle as you put your ticket in the slit You walk through and collect your ticket Save your ticket you will need to to exit the station once you get to your stop     On Chatuchak market days Friday Sunday there is a large increase in the amount of people in the train You will be packed with people around you Remember to be clean showered and beleive in the power of deodorant  If you are funky smelling you will be noticed for all the wrong reasons People are polite and keep to themselves Keep an eye on your purse and wear your backpack in the front just for common sense safety     There are seating available (seating is usually given to monks elderly and pregnant women but if it is empty have a seat) There are many places to hold onto if standing It is air conditioned so it will be a relief from the heat Many of the stations had food and snack stands in case you are hungry or thirsty I didn't notice if there were any restroomtoilet area As a family we felt safe and less stressed using the skytrain

reviewText: The BTS system has improved so much over the years that it really is a wonder as to why one would not be travelling using this ultra convenient cheap and clean mode of transportation  The BTS links with major shopping malls eg Phrom Pong links with Emporium Siam links with Siam Paragon and National Stadium links with the infamous MBK
Way to overcrowded I was literally being crushed against the door between some people Might be a good way of getting around but avoid peak hour at all cost
Great train service but be aware that you must use coins or dollars to buy your ticket    There are two different train systems that require different types of tickets

easy to buy the ticket (prepare coins) help us to go to many destinations in Bangkok Although Bangkok people are not really proud of their BTS but for me this is adequate Of course a mass rapid transportation cannot come directly to your house but this is more than enough

reviewTitle: The only way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: Forget about taxis and tuktuks They can take far too long from A to B  The main stations can be very very busy during peak times   Always keep coins to avoid queues for change

reviewTitle: The most efficient transport system in the world, including the UK underground
reviewText: OK first thing  You arrive in Bangkok  You haven't been to SEA before you're a little gun shy  Easy way to get to city from airport is taxi right  Don't  Step up  The BTS is easy just ask a local  It's cheap it's clean it's on time  Why waste the money on a moto or taxi

reviewTitle: You can go to anywhere with BTS
reviewText: I always love BTS ride The thing I love most about it is you can go anywhere with BTS and many shopping malls are connected to the stations

reviewTitle: Accessible to reach most of the Tourist places
reviewText: Accessible to reach most of the Tourist places  The must visit places via SkyTrain are Nana(Night Market) Asok(Terminal 21 Shopping Mall) National Stadium (Shopping Mall) Mo Chit (Weekend Market)  Sapan Taksin (Asiatique Riverfront Market)

reviewTitle: Definitely the way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: Our family of four rode the BTS the length of both lines using one day passes  It's a great way to get a feeling for the city  As noted by others it can be crowded during rush hours but it is still a great way to move across the city  Anything that keeps you out of the ground traffic is a good idea  (Loved the subway for the same reason)  The BTS is clean efficient and the riders were very courteous and respectful  Be aware that during rush it can be quite crowded in areas close to the city center  We found the crosswalks and pedestrian walkways for the BTS a good way to avoid crossing the busy streets around Siam Square Terminal 21 and Central World  On top of everything else it is inexpensive and easy to use

reviewTitle: It is quite convenient to ride
reviewText: There are only two sky train lines But it is also connected to the underground metro as well Although a whole part of the city does not get covered by either It is still convenient to ride these whenever ther eis a station close by Beware that during commute hours it can get quite crowded though

Transportation are amazing and wonderful  Taxi are safe and sound  Cleaning everywhere  Safe and secure for everyone  Citizens are friendly and reliable  Bangkok is beautiful city  Shopping mall are superb  Enjoyable  Miss you Bangkok  Love you Thailand

Don't be scared Just use logic and buying tickets via the machine makes sense If not ask someone or a staff member Remember to pick up a printed map and make sure you get off at the right stop You can ride the whole train system for 25 bhat if you are inclined that way Just make sure it is within the two hours allocated If you exceed the time that be honest with the staff and confess and they will let you pay for another ticket and not the fine Now go exploring

Cheap efficient clean and easy to use Best to have a pocket full of change to avoid a long queue when you're buying a ticket On the ticket machine the number by the station you wish to go to is the fare you gave to pay Machines also give change if you haven't the exact cost of the fare Some of the stations do have a lot of steps to go up to the platform and one or two of the automatic exit barriers are a bit quick at closing so if you're male and don't want a painful experience don't hang about The trains obviously get very busy at certain times of the day so if you can't cope with being crushed against complete strangers then this mode of transport isn't for you
We took the BTS to the Saturday market which was very enjoyable No rush and pushing and people were very friendly to give us a seat
This is just like Delhi Metro very easy to go any where in Bangkok yes defiantly not useful to go outside of city But really low cost transport

BKK is notorious for it's traffic so the best way to get around BKK is the BTS  It's very clean fast and highly efficient with frequent trains It does get very busy during the rush hour though You can buy daily or weekly travel tickets which I would suggest to avoid buying a ticket each time you take the train it also works out a lot cheaper  The queues for buying the tickets can also be very long  If you run out of coins the lady at the counter can change your notes to coins but she will not issue you a ticket

In Bangkok for my own opinion BTS is the most convenient public transport in city during peak hour or off peak  Sometimes during peak hour even is lots of people waiting but no doubt it still can send you to your destination more faster than taxi  Buy a rabbit card and reload the credit then you can easily to go anywhere you want

reviewTitle: Easy way to travel around town
reviewText: Sky train is a cheap and quick way to travel around Bangkok but unfortunately it doesn't go everywhere you need It does go through to main streets like Siam Sukhumvit Asok Nana and National Stadium to name a few which are all tourist destinations for their many malls and exciting street markets

reviewTitle: The 'Life-Saver' in the heart of 'bumper-to-bumper' Bangkok !
reviewText: Quick Easy Efficient & Dependable are the best ways to describe the wonderful system of transport in Bangkok Trains travel at 2 minute intervals  miss one and grab the next  Air Conditioning could be a tad cold for some but it is heavenly for someone who has just come off the hot sweaty streets of the city Cabins are clean and there are strict 'noeating or drinking' rules Commuters are most often very courteous and patient Signage and staff are excellent Access to stations and the 'Rabbit' Ticket system work very well
BTS Skytrain is easy to navigate for foreigners and very reasonably priced Air conditioned and friendly staff

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The skytrain is an excellent cheap way to get around Bangkok  Taxis may be a little cheaper but the skytrain is quick and efficient
The system connects you to major shopping but not to all the great tourist sites It is cheap and clean

It has a booth for coins then you buy your ticket from a machine using coins only Your ticket price depends on how many stops you are going to pass Keep your ticket as you will need it to get out of the station There is no information booth but the employees at the coin booth are very helpful  The only negative thing is that the train is freezing
BTS SKytrain is the public transportation in Bankok Easy to go But sometimes tired coz need to go upstair and downstar always to get the train or stranfer station

reviewTitle: Clean, cool and a good view!
reviewText: We took the BTS a couple of times and during the day as well as at night the view and AC were a bonus to this very relaxed way to get around Bangkok The prices vary depending on the distance you want to travel The ticket machines are very easy to operate Definitely a do in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Good way to avoid traffic jam
reviewText: Although a Rabbit card costs nonrefundable THB80 I still recommend you to buy one to avoid from queuing for tickets
Reliable and cheap Get your tickets before you get on at the machine Seems to take change only but there is a kiosk where you can get change Trains are every few minutes

Great  fast and clean train service Maps simple to understand but tickets not always easy to buy We managed to under pay for the number of stops buying through the ticket machine and then had to pay the excess fare at the counter  no fines just frustrating that we didn't work it out right Carriages get very busy in rush hour
If youre in bangkok its really difficult that you wont travel on the BTS It is a good overhead train service with various good stops and we used it quite often
This metro is easy to navigate around town and I felt super safe around all stations and areas Also inexpensive and clean

It's the only way to get around cheaply with no taxituktuk ripoffs great scenery en route professionally run international standards for safety allows folding bikes alwaysnonfolding early morn and after 10 pm

reviewTitle: Best way to travel around Bangkok
reviewText: People are disciplined and have seen people give up their seats to the elderly pregnant women and kids Also very easy to understand which train to take

The skytrain is the way to go around bangkok If you don't have coins to buy tickets from the ticket machine buy it over the counter The ticket tellers are always nice You can buy a single ticket or a pass for several trips

reviewTitle: Trip to Siam Square from Krung Thon Buri
reviewText: Fast & efficient travel much better than taxi Best way to explore Bangkok city especially Siam Square where u can walk via Skywalk to Central World & surrounding areas

reviewTitle: Great public transit system, easy to navigate!
reviewText: I was coming from the airport and found the link between Mo Chi Station and the airport to be clearly identified I got off at Mo Chi and it was easy to navigate through the city Some stations like Sala Daeng accept coins only one at a time which makes the process really slow when buying transit tickets for a group of people but other stations have updated their system accepting cash and multiple people All of the stations I've visited have great selection of food and cafes nom nom nom Just be sure to finish everything before hopping on the BTS as food and drinks are not permitted
Easiest way to get around in Bangkok The ticket system isn't the greatest though if you're staying for a few days We ended up buying day passes most of our days

Don't be scared to use BTS it's easy choose which station you want to go to and the number next to it is baht price press number it will light up and drop coins in to the value And card will drop out then put card in turnstile and it will be sucked in and then pop out at the top and the gates will open take the card and off you go
A cheap faster transportation option if you don't want to be fleeced by taxi drivers and caught in traffic

reviewTitle: Smooth and quick public tranportation system
reviewText: BTS skytrain in Bangkok just awesome Very quick and smooth No difficulties for new users so easy to buy tickets with coins available maps everywhere Announcement in every moment where it is and where to go
During the office hours there is a heavy rush so avoid office hours One has to take coins from the kiosk to buy tokens from the machine

Trains are frequent and very comfortable The guard at the station was very helpful and friendy to me Signs at the station and announcements on trains are very great and helpful I enjoyed the view from windows so much This is way more fun than MRT Though the price is quite high for a relatively short distance
Stations are nicely arranged Properly directed Supporting peoples are helpful Inside the train is neat and clean and comfortable
Easy to get around however if you are buying the one time ticket you need to standby coins else u have to go for the longer Q to pay with notes  Only downside ITS ALWAYS SUPER CROWDED

reviewTitle: Best way of moving around Bangkok
reviewText: Use BTS in the first couple of days of your stay in Bangkok before you get used to the somewhat chaotic traffic below your feet You can buy a Rabbit card (deposit THB 50 + as per number of rides) and use it on pay as you go basis Small kids under 100cm tall ride for free
Easy Get change from kiosk and buy ticket Most rides 42 baht Kiosk gives you a ticket sometimes  Trains frequent and clean Ca n be crowded

reviewText: I don't understand why we have to q up for exchange the coin then we have to q up again for a ticket and if you need to buy a day pass ticket please ask your hotel first if they have available at the hotel or not but anyway you have to queue with the same line with the passenger who want to change the coin Please change the coin from the hotel if you don't need to waste the time(especially for peak hour and busy station such as Paragon)

reviewTitle: Easiest and safest way to go around Bangkok

reviewTitle: Great way to commute in Bangkok!

Best way to travel in bangkok Fast easy access and reasonable cheap Our hotel was 50 steps away from the station so why look further

reviewTitle: Faster and cooler way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The system is easy to understand faster than taking taxi especially during rush hour The people are organized and disciplined lining up and waiting patiently Felt safe since there were a lot of police presence near the trains The trains are clean eating is prohibited and the AC is strong Most of the time it's easy to find seating They give up seating for children pregnant women and monks Hopefully they will be able to update the ticketing as one reviewer mentioned It will be more convenient to have coins at hand to save time if not have to get in line at the counter for change
I can control my timing to do business easy clean safety and convenient  good for life style in the capital but a little bit expensive

reviewTitle: Best form of public transport I have ever used.
reviewText: Easy to use safe and consistently reliable Also great for avoiding the intense heat due to the epic AC on board the carriages It's a shame it doesn't stretch throughout more of Bangkok because the MRT (although still good) is no where near as good as the BTS

If you are tired of waiting for bus take the BTS skytrain it more expensive but faster and cleaner They have big map placed at strategic location at every stop or if dont know for certain you can ask the officer or juat show them the mapplace where you want to gostop

reviewTitle: One of the best public transport systems in the world
reviewText: Using the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok is the best way to get around quickly in Bangkok In a city of an estimated 12 million people (unofficially) traffic congestions and gridlock for hours is a common occurence The Skytrain gets you fast to your destinations and with the connections to the MRT subway system you have a very modern cheap and efficient way of getting around Now that the Skytrain has an airport link to the interrnational airport you can even get to and from Suvanabhumi to the city in no time

reviewTitle: Modern and efficient except ticketing process
reviewText: Originally modeled after the Vancouver Skytrain Bangkok's BTS Skytrain long in its planning (started around the early 1990s) and has gone through many iterations and building problems At the end it is a very modern and efficient public transport system It is the fastest way of getting around town especially during rush hour  beating driving taxis or even Tuttuts that can weave in traffic It runs along the busy road of Sukhumvit and Silom The stations are clean and modern with good security The trains runs very frequently so there is little wait time usually   However there are several shortcomings One the ticketing process is inefficient and chaotic as (singleride) rides are first required to line up to get changes (paper money into coins) at the both Then he will need to line up for a second time to purchase from a ticketing machine that has no queue lines When the traffic gets heavy the waiting time can be 15 minutes or so and the process is chaotic A cashless card you can chargerefill would be good I understand that they are working on a better ticketing system Secondly the cost of the Skytrain ride is expensive as compared to other methods of transportation in Bangkok say the MRT subway (even though the MRT is much older) Third the elevated (rather than underground) train kind of destroys the city landscape and produces noise and pollution
One of the best Metro line I ever seen Secure clean well organised Having small cash helps to get your ticket promptly as most machine do not take note upper than 100 baths

Used this for most of out traveling around Bangkok So easy to use and buy tickets very clean and also take in some scenery Some stations are busier than others but still no hassle best way and cheapest to get around
Easier than I thought It costs about 40 to go anywhere but pretty in expensive to use Great way to get to places to shop site see etc

I wish all public transportation systems in major cities worked as well as the BTS Skytrain  The Skytrain was close to our hotel and was a gem to get us from one end of the Sukhumvit area to the other Highly recommend it

reviewTitle: Safe, clean, comfortable, efficient, modern rapid transit
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is the best choice to avoid traffic jams and the hassle of traveling intoout ofacross central Bangkok  Although the fare is a little bit high compared with the cost of living in Thailand BTS Skytrain provide safe clean comfortable and efficient choice to the public with high standard  The drawback is only the limited number of lifts and escalators discouraging the elderly and the handicapped to use the service  It should improve accessibility
Good service can be more efficient and reliable though many people travel through it but not tourist friendly Not good as singapore
Use it while in Bangkok it's very clean can be busy but works on time and is very frequent Cost is per destination maximum you pay is abt 80cents

reviewTitle: A great way to get around the City
reviewText: I watched the BTS being built 18 years ago It had early faults but is now vastly improved Most stations have "up" but not "down" escalators Many stations now have elevators for wheelchair access etc This didn't used to be the case  New line extensions are currently being built The rail cars have powerful aircon offering a very pleasant respite from the hot humid climes outside Around the SiamCentral World & Chitlom areas there is a fair amount of elevated walkways which unlike Bangkok pavements is smooth & safe  Given the ever increasing traffic  this undoubtedly is the best way to get around the city and a bonus is you have an elevated view of your surroundings You can dismount at any station on your journey have a look at your surroundings from the station & reboard again or even cross over & go the opposite end without extra charge  For tourists it is best to buy a multiple trip ticket (10 or 20 trips etc) & it works out at 25 to 30 Baht per trip
A great way to beat the traffic the trains run every 5 minutes and are clean The ticket you purchase has a map of the skytrain stops and each station is announced in English and thia as you approach

Very affordable and takes you almost everywhere (well close that is) Also very easy to navigate It is a very organized train system ) Ticket machines only accepts coins and there is cashiers always there being able to change cash to coins from very early to very late I also recommend getting the bts skytrain app it's very helpful and tells you which stop to get off depending on where you want to go or can tell you what is the nearest stop near you Great train )

reviewTitle: The fastest way to avoid traffic jam
reviewText: Bangkok is know as the city with traffic jam Its better than Jakarta but traffic is the problem BTS is the best way to avoid traffic It is convenient and on time Sadly it is not to all direction
Wonderful service  Reliable clean and safe reasonable prices if you want to move in the kaos of Bangkok

reviewTitle: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The BTS is the monorail in Bangkok  It is clean runs frequently stops are announced in EnglishThai as well as appearing on screens and the stations have good signage  The ticket machines take only coins  go to the window to get coins if you do not have enough change for your trip  See photo below The trip's cost is by distance (1552 baht)  Look at the stop where you want to go to get the cost and then push that button then put in the coins for the ticket  The machine will give you a card for the trip and any change if due  If you are sensitive to AC bring a scarf or extra layer for longer trips  the cars can get chilly

We go to Bangkok with my little kids They are about 7 & 8 years old We take the BTS more than 10 times during the trip And the Thai people is  very polite  They  give the seats to my sons every times It  is very polite country
The BTS Skytrain in Bangkok is one of the easiestcleanest and efficient train systems in the world
Great way to get around Bangkok avoiding the traffic Very cheap to Used the BTS 56 times and also used the airport shuttle to and from the airport
The trains are always clean very comfortable and most important always on time This is the way to get around Bangkok
We used the BTS whilst exploring Bangkok as part of our holiday in Thailand We thought it was a good way of travelling in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Super Effecient.  Best way to travel
reviewText: Dont bother with the roads in Bangkok taxis rickshaws unless its very late at night when the roads are quiet(ish)   The BTS Skytrain is be far the best way to get around and its cheap air conditioned and very quick
This is a great way to move around in Bangkok Very easy and cheap Just stay away during rush hour

Very easy to use and understand Purchasing tickets were so easy it's the first system i have used with no complications  The train is very busy most of the time but they are so reliable and very cool and also very cheap I recommend this form of transport around Bangkok

reviewTitle: Nice and well organized public transport
reviewText: Any big city need a good public transportation and looking at the very busy streets of Bangkok any time of the day taking the BTS Skytrain is definitely a good idea Good speaking vendors in at the counter fair price (from 15 BTH onwards) and easy to use ticketing system

After been in taxis with so congested slow traffic all the time or been walking in the dust noise and heat of summer getting into the train was such a good feeling  it's cool and clean and it has no traffic jams The only down side is you have to do self service at the machines to get your ticket and those machines only accept coins it can be troublesome when you try to figure out for the first time

plenty of trains so you never have to wait long to catch one At some stations  single tickets can only be purchased from machines that only take coins which is a bit annoying because they make you queue to change your bills and then to get your ticket The stations are very clean everything is easy to find and the security level is high (bag checks etc)
Avoid rush hour  Excellent way to navigate Bangkok  Cheap easy and clean  Bangkok is such an amazing place easy to get lost but easy with this service in all the main spots

reviewTitle: A good way of getting around town, but it can be crowded.
reviewText: Although it only runs on two lines limiting its coverage of Bangkok it's an easy safe and inexpensive way to get around town  Be warned most of the ticket machines only take coins and the ones that accept notes won't accept anything bigger 100 baht it's a good idea to have some change before you go

A lesson could be learned by Australian rail operators If they studied the BTS  A ticketing system that's simple to use and works every time Friendly staff who can be called upon to help at any time The platform safety barriers are great and the way Thais let the disembarking travellers off before joining the train is a great example of Thai curtesy This is one of the best rail systems in the world

BANGKOK has a very clean and reliable train system There are many shopping lodging and eating options along the BTS There is even an easy ride from the airport to the city center Research to save money on taxi's
Apart from rush hours (when it's pretty busy) the BTS is pretty easy to use and so much faster than any taxi as BKK traffic jams are notorious

reviewTitle: Really the easiest way around central Bangkok
reviewText: This is a user friendly and essential way of getting around the normally chaotic central areas of Bangkok especially the main shopping areas along Sukhumvit Rd  The only negatives are the rush hour where the trains are packed and the often freezing airconditioning
Fantastic and quick Here to there in minutes and really efficient There were a few Mothers begging with children on the bridge but it was fine We used this skytrain daily
If you are going to be staying in Bangkok for more than a week be sure to get the Rabbit card It's a great new system and you can use it to buy food at the Siam Paragon and also MBK

Our hotel was near sukhumvit So the skytrain was the best way to move from east to west of bangkok Even to catch boats on charopraya river it was fast to reach saphan taksin stop from anywhere around the skytrain There is a train every 3 min It s clean efficient and great to cool down when too warm in bkk It s cost efficient to take the day pass

reviewTitle: Good unless you need an elevator
reviewText: The BTS really makes getting around easy but if you need an elevator you're kinda hooped I was staying near Asoke station and while there was an elevator you were lucky if someone actually replied to the call button and brought the elevator down And if you were coming down from up there's no button to call you've got to hunt someone down to help So while the transit itself is good elevator wise this is not a user friendly system
Its better and convenient to take BTS to go for shopping and sight seeing You can beat Bangkok trafficand also lots of bargain for Tuk Tuk and Taxi
Easy to use just look at it before you travel this way you will have a better time Most trips on the Sky train are very cheap

I used the BTS Skytrain as my primary mode of transportation in Bangkok besides walking  Just be aware that as is in many places in Bangkok there will be a security screener at the entrance that quickly checks peoples bags and purses for dangerous items  Just make their life easier and offer to show them that you don't have any dangerours items and you'll have no issues  Another tip If you are towing luggage through the entry gate turnstiles walk quickly through it so that the gate doesn't close on your luggage  Also be sure to use common sense and let people exit the train first before entering  The Thais are friendly and have common sense in this regard some tourists don't

reviewTitle: Fast - faster than taxi and tuk-tuk
reviewText: It's a pity that BTS doesn't go as far as to the river but a very good and efficient transport mode in Bangkok Mostly above ground so you can get an impression of the city as well  Trains can be crowded (not really a surprise) in particular during rush hours

Public transportation in Bangkok was only fair  The BTS was not cheap at all maybe taxi was even cheaper  However roads in Bangkok easily have traffic jam so tourists had no choice  We travelled a lot by BTS in the 4day visit in Bangkok

Great way to travel cheaply the trains are very clean (cleaner than the streets) faster than a Taxi due to the road congestion DO NOT travel during office hours 79 am as you will be packed in like a Sardine

Although the BTS is quite new it would be goo if they expanded t a bit more It is a good way to get to the centre of the city and everything is well indicated so you can't get lost And it's quite cheap too
We travelled from our hotel to the Ocean World Was very happy to see the respect given to us by the local traveler when we entered the train they offered their own seats to us
The BTS is a great way to get around Bangkok Esp from between 48pm where all traffic comes to a standstill  Air con is a releive
This was public transportation that was extremely inexpensive and easy to use despite the language barrier You will get to your destination quicker than a taxis

If you arrive at the airport at a reasonable time and you know where you're going you can probably easily get there via the skytrain However it's best for getting from one area of Bangkok to another without having to be stuck in a traffic jam and if you like shopping all the Malls seem to be linked by the skytrain system With average prices of about 30p you can't go wrong

The BTS is a great mode of transportation while is Bangkok My suggestion to visitors is to get the card where you can put a certain amount of money on it so you don't have to keep going to the machines
Great  servicevery cheap clean  easy to use Efficient for travelling around city Used it every day
It's really convient and cleanAlthough only 2 routesthey are all through the main viewshopping mall or any other in Bangkok

As public transit systems in the world go the BTS is surprisingly awesome and its arrival in Bangkok just over 15 years ago was a game changer for the entire city on multiple fronts traffic air pollution navigability It makes it possible to zoom through the city even when monsoon rains and rush hour traffic make streets impassable More and more stations are now connected to malls and other buildings by elevated walkways making it possible to see a lot of Bangkok's central attractions without braving the crowded sidewalks I ride it every day for my commute and encounter only the occasional delay If you're visiting Bangkok as a tourist it's a marvelous worryfree alternative to taxis who may "forget" to turn on the meter and then overcharge you or tuktuks who offer you cheap rides only to claim the temple you wanted to see is "closed for a national holiday" and deposit you at a tailor or gem shop instead The only downsides are that it doesn't cover nearly all of Bangkok  the underground MRT helps expand its range but neither covers the old town sites of greatest interest to tourists  and that at certain hours and certain stations it can suddenly become almost insufferably crowded Evening rush hour at Asok Sala Daeng or Siam station Oof Be ready to wait on an extremely crowded platform for multiple trains to pass before you'll be able to shoehorn yourself in And forget about buying a singleuse pass at those hours at those hub stations the lines are insane Get a rabbit card instead and you can zip right through

reviewTitle: An Option to Avoid Bangkok Traffic Snarls
reviewText: I use the BTS as one way of avoiding the road traffic in Bangkok especially when the roads are clogged or after a torrential downpour I also use the river and canal boats for the same purpose  Depending on the starting point and destination one or the other may be the appropriate choice For example one consideration if visiting Platinum Mall at Pratunam is the BTS station is a rather longer walk away compared to the canal boat station particularly on a hot day   BTS travel is generally cooler than boat travel However in peak hours the BTS trains can be like cans of sardines   One has to be nimble and quick when using canal or river boats  get in and out fast and with stability Further avoid water splashes while crusing along Boats can also be pretty packed at peak hours  Economics should not be ignored The BTS is excellent value for long journeys eg from Mo Chit to Saphan Taksin or On Nut BTS day tickets for much BTS travel in a day can prove to be a deal Taxis can be good value if travelling in a group of say 4 persons River and canal boats are generally inexpensive (perhaps tourist boats excepted) Don't forget the buses too as they are inexpsensive with the aircon ones being more comfortable The conductors and fellow passengers are generally helpful when it comes to point of disembarkation Motorbike taxis are convenient but when more than one is travelling consider the taxi too eg 20 THB for a short ride but for the same journey for 2 persons a taxi could be of equivalent cost Using the tuk tuk is an art when it comes to economics for a foreign visitor

reviewTitle: Just about the most convenient way to get around Bangkok.

reviewTitle: Best Way to travel within Bangkok
reviewText: This is the best and fastest way to travel within Bangkok The traffic is so bad in Bangkok that taxis can take a long time to get around the city   So if your destination is anywhere near a BTS station take this as your first option  If you are going to use it frequently buy a train pass at the station  You just add as much money as you want and you can always cash it out at the end of your trip  It saves you waiting in line to buy tickets especially during busy times  Trains come around every 5 mins so you never wait too long  And the AC on the train is comforting as Bangkok is Always Hot  Train rides are based on distance but expect to average $1 USD per one way  So it's clean fast and cheap

The Bangkok Transport System (BTS) or Skytrain is a cool and especially handy way around toen and the best way to beat the notorious traffic jams According to the latest TomTom Traffic index about 57% of travel time is now wasted on any time traveling on the streets of Bangkok not just between 57 PM For both Tourist and resident the BTS makes live easier to get around although the service does not cover all of Bangkok yet Various extensions are under construction   With clever use however you can go around beat traffic and get to all almost major attractions or connecting ways of transport like subway Airport Link Bus Terminals like Ekkemai meeting poinst like Victory Monument and the Chao Praya River Boat Express So the service is also handy as a starling point on a trip further away  There are 2 major lines the Silom line from National Stadium (near MBK Shopping Centre) to Bang Wah (Thonburi Side) and the Sukhumwit line from Mochit (near the Weekend Market) and Bearing (direction BangNa highway) Remember those endpoints as they are used on the signs as the direction of travel So let say travelling from Ekemai to Victory Monument the correct direction will be Mochit  Enter a BTS station (BTS logo and massive concrete construction above you're head) go to the ticket coin machine and hand over those 10 Baht coins These are the ones with the golden centre The machine will also accept smaller coins  Choose you're destination first by pressing the correspondent button (they have a unique code like E7 for Ekkemai) pay and collect the plastic ticket Keep it with you as you need it for passing the lane at start and destination  Nowadays there are also touch screen machines in Thai and English language which will accept both coins and banknotes At these touch screens you can als top up the Rabbit Cards a more easier prepaid way to avoid stacking up or changing banknotes at the counter You can buy the type1 card for 80  Baht (no deposit) and add eather a number of 30 day valid trips or an amount (100 Baht up to max 4000 Bath) or even both Unless you are frequent in Bangkok I advise the easy topup method Your money will keep it's value for some years Buy the Rabbit card at the counter they have Adult and Student types Just hold the card at the detection lane and wait for the green light to let you pass Usually there are seperate lanes for Rabbid card at most right hand side  Finally to sum up the major points on the 2 lines  Sukhumwit Line   N8 Mochit endpoint Weekend Market Bangkok Chatuchak (biggest semiopen Market in Thailand selling literally everything) Chatuchak Park and nearby Mochit Bus Terminal connection with Metro station Chatuchak Park  N3 Victory Monument (soawalee as Thai call it) walking distance to the old city centre with GrandPalace temple of declining buddha etc Also at this very busy interjunction at the left and right Side and in Soi to Phetburi Road several minivan services will take you to various destinations in and around Bangkok Ayutthaya for example Prices vary from 3035 Baht to 5060 Baht These services run all day untill early evening and are widely used bij Thai people commuting At Victory momument you pay at the counter along the way they will stop at bus stops to pick people up and you pay by putting money in a basket Just ask the price if you are not sure  N2 Phya Thai connection with the excellent and cheap Airport City Link to Suvarnabhumi Airport But also the getting off point for walking to the famous Pratunam (Watergate) river taxi stops Pratunam clothings Market and Central WorldErawan shrine if you like walking for about 45 minutes  E3 Nana for the (in)famous entertainment strip  E4 Asok connection with Metro  E7 Ekkamai for the Bus Station to Pattaya and eastern destinations Ice Speed Rink SubZero (wednesday discount 50% off regular price)  Silom Line   W1 National Stadium MKB shopping centre Sport Stadium (running track and olympic size swimming pool for those who want to sport)  Siam interchange between Silom and Sukhumwit line be sure to choose the right platform sometimes you have to go upstairsdownstairs look carefully at the signs  remember all 4 endpoints by name Siam Paragorn shopping centre and cinema Sea Aquarium  S2 Sala Daeng connection with Metro from here you can connect to 1 of the piers of the Chao Praya River Express boats  S3 Chong Nonsi connection with Bus Rapid Transit Route (BRT) a new bus service that runs south along Rama 9 and Rama 3 bridge to the Thonburi side to  S6 Saphan Thaksin Brinks to the bridge near The Ori√´ntal hotel Silom Road and (in) famous Patpong area S10 Bang Wah terminal station not to far from busstop to The Mall Bangkae with Fantasy Lagoon rooftop swimming park (wonderfull for Family with children)  Oh and don't forget to grab a free copy of the BTS system with some handy maps

reviewText: Growing up in New York City I have become a bit of a snob when it comes to railed transportation in cities  The BTS SkyTrain is wonderfully kept easy to navigate and an absolute necessity to speedy travel above Bangkok instead of getting caught in the traffic below  A wonderful vein of the Bangkok daily life that everyone should venture on  JM

the BTS Skytrain is a very easy and fast train to bring you everywhere in Bangkok According to the traffic jam i prefer this in most situation before i take a taxi (It`s faster and cheaper)  The system is really easy   Go to the station  Check at the plans (they are at the ticket machines) which destination you want  Directly at the Destination on the map you find a number (which is the price for one way  28 32 48 and so on)  If you don`t have enough coins go to the informationdesk they will change it for your (if you tell them where you want to go they give it already suitable to you)  go back to the machine and point on the number (which is the price)  so if your destination costs 28 Baht just point on "28"  Pay  Get the ticket and go to trains  That`s it  Easy and fast system  if i compare to german ticket machines it is really crazy how easy it is

reviewTitle: Convenient and Normally Quick Transportation in Bangkok
reviewText: I use the BTS to commute backforth to school twice a week It's convenient to my house about a 10 minute walk to Ploen Chit station I take the Sukhumvit line change at Siam to the Silom line to Chong Nonsi There are times that I have had to wait for a second train at Ploen Chit and once had to wait on a 3rd train at Siam Also the prices for the trip passes has recently increased The 15 ride pass is now 450 baht But it's still more economical money and time wise than buying individual fares The BTS covers much of Bangkok's attractions and riders can switch to the MRT or BRT at designated stations However if your destination is Ko Rattanakosin (the older part of Bangkok) you're out of luck with BTS However you can ride to Saphan Taksin and hop on a river boat taxi that will take you to Tha Tien pier where it is a short walk to Wat Po and Wat Phra Gaew

reviewTitle: Among the best metro transportation in the world
reviewText: While staying in Bangkok you're strongly recommended to experience the BTS Skytrain  It will take you to many destinations for little money with lots of comfort safety and ease to navigate   You'll be come an expert after your first ride Btw like many modem metro systems in the world you'll want to hold on to your ticket until your exit   You will be very independent all the way between buying tickets to exit the stop or transfer between lines   Most likely you'll find it a cheap and comfortable way to view Bangkok neighborhoods especially during day time

reviewTitle: Fast and comfortable Don Muang airport transfer
reviewText: Bangkok's skytrain (BTS) complements other below ground services and the airport sky link   Further new lines are being added    Trains are regular fast and clean  The BTS is also an excellent choice for air travelers who can board along Sukhumvit (where most hotels are) and exit at Mochit with A1 or A2 Airport bus service connection  Carrying luggage children elderly or infirm is not a problem with lifts available at most major stations incl Mochit  The current total cost per person is in the region of 70 BT per person from say Asoke to Don Muang which compares favourable against taxis  The BTSbus services often faster as they bypass congestion in peak times

reviewTitle: Great way to get around - clean and AC is awesome
reviewText: Helpful if you buy tickets ahead of time as the lines at some stations can be as long as your sky train trip  With a little planning you can figure out how much you need to load on your ticket and buy ahead of time at the glass booth

This is definatley the best way to get around Bangkok and its worth buying a Rabbit Pass and loading it with Thai Baht its like our Myki Card but better

reviewTitle: A great alternative to handle the horrible BKK traffic. But with limitations...
reviewText: If you're looking for a quick way to move around some attractions this is a great choice  Taking a taxi or a tuktuk can be a nightmare during rush hours which is most of the day except for the night PROS  It's FAST and useful for some destinations cheaper for a couple has a good connection with the ferry service CONS  can get really crowded it's not that cheaper if you're traveling as a family and it doesn't get you everywhere

reviewTitle: Not the best, but sometimes the only choice.
reviewText: The BTS skytrain seems to get busier and more crowded every day From a service where you could always get a seat to the point now where you'll often need to wait for 2 or 3 trains to pass before you can squeeze on Not so bad during the middle of the day or late at night On a positive it's super reliable and a hundred times better than sitting in Bangkok traffic   If you're staying in town for a while the refillable rabbit cards won't save you any money but they'll save you lining up for a ticket every time and they can be used at food courts and other places around town Multiple trip cards don't work out very good value unless you are travelling long distances    Worth noting there's no eating or drinking on the BTS and most stations do not have elevators (working ones) for anyone with mobility issues

reviewTitle: Get to know the BTS and MRT
reviewText: If you are staying in Bangkok a while make sure to get the rabbit card Load it up with however much baht you want So when it gets busy you do not have to wait in line to get changebuy tickets It simple swipe to access Get to know the BTSMRT lines and areas as the traffic in Bangkok is CRAZY   If you want to rent a scooter be careful as riding in Bangkok is different than in Canada or Vietnam They do not watch out for you  If you use it a lot in the day buy the Day pass for the MRT they have dayweekmonth pass  Both lines shuts down at 12 Midnight Taxis and Tuktuk knows this so they will start charging 100200 baht right away ALWAYS ask for meter and if they say no move on The older taxi drivers will usually say yes to the meters as the younger ones will try to rip you

reviewTitle: Easy to figure out and get around as an English speaker
reviewText: My first ride on the Skytrain was on my own although with specific directions from the front desk staff at my hotel  There are maps and signs all around in both Thai and English so it was easy to orient myself  Without any trouble I found the correct platform made my transfer at Siam and made it to my stop  On the train they announce the stations in both Thai and English so it is easy to know when to get off  There are also detailed maps that help you navigate to the correct exit for your destination which is wonderful because it keeps you from having to cross too many streets at street level and navigate the traffic    The trains were clean and I don't think I waited more than five minutes for a train the entire trip  I recommend this over taking a taxi as the traffic in Bangkok can cause you to waste a lot of time waiting to move    You can purchase tickets with either coin or paper money but pay attention because certain machines take coin only  Ticket prices are reasonable although at peak times the queue for purchasing tickets can take a while

reviewTitle: Best way to travel around Bangkok
reviewText: One of the life lines of Bangkok city with MRT BRT and Chao Phraya boat expresses The best way to travel in Bangkok is the BTS and MRT There is heavy traffic on the roads and you will invariably get stuck in one place or the other for at least an hour most of the times We got stuck in one traveling by a taxi from Mo Chit terminal 2 Bus station to Mo chit BTS station A distance which must not take more than 10 mts and 50 Baht took us almost an hour and costed 100 Baht Yes taxi meter keeps running faster when it is stuck in a signal or traffic jam than when it is on the move or that is what you will feel Trains and stations are very clean There are security personal to guide you how to reach the near by malls There are 2 lines of BTS  Sukhumvit and silom line The malls have direct access from the stations or sky walks which takes you in the direction you want to go Each station will have a map of the BTS lines so you can easily find out where you want to go and what will be the fare If you are there for just a day and wanted to travel a lot buy a one day ticket for 120 Baht and you can travel as many times and trips that day If you are staying for 3 or more days you can buy rabbit cards which allows you to prepay and make many trips and saves you the hassle of checking the price or buying a ticket every time You will get a refund of the unused amount when you return the card Taxi will seem the cheaper option when there are 4 people but then you are likely to get stuck in the traffic any time of the day The BTS starts at 6 am and runs till mid night There is a train for every 3 or 5 mts During peak hours the train are crowded but still you can travel There will be announcements as to what is the next station in the train so that you know when your stop is due There are stations which are interconnection between the two lines and other stations which are interconnections with the MRT To travel via boat take Silom line BTS train to Sapan Taskin station and walk down the steps directly to Central Pier from where you will get several type of boats to travel along the river Places like Grand Palace Wat Pho Wat Arun China Town Thonburi station are easily reached by boar

reviewTitle: Cheap and easy.  Taxi advice below
reviewText: If you are worried about getting screwed by the taxi from the airport  or anywhere for matter  take bts  For a couple of bucks you can get from airport to Sukumvit or silom areas  It's air conditioned and on time  If you have lots of luggage or heavy bags then it might be better in a cab  If so tell you taxi to use meter  If he refuses get out of cab and get another  There are hundreds of cabs  If you have problem with them use your phone and take picture of their I'D located on dash   Then say you call tourist police or police They will turn meter on or leave  Don't let them give you a set price  Some of them are honest but many are not and think all tourists are stupid  So I hope this helps someone  FYI fare from suvarnabumi to Sukumvit is 350 to 450 baht traffic pending with tolls

reviewTitle: The easiest way to get around central Bangkok
reviewText: My review is probably going to echo most other reviews on this site Yes the BTS is the easiest way to get around the central areas of Bangkok  There are two different BTS lines  one that runs through Sukhumvit which does the central areas of the city Easy access to the largest malls in Bangkok (Paragon Central etc) There is a second BTS line that you can use if you're at Siam BTS station This line runs through Silom and to yet another mall  MBK On this line you can get to the more outskirty areas like Saphan Taksin Chinatown etc  Do be aware that no BTS line actually goes as far as Khao San road or the Grand Palace   If you ask for directions to the closest Skytrain from a local it's best not to call it Skytrain Here in Bangkok people just refer to it as the BTS  You can buy day tickets for a small amount and if you're a tourist this is probably the best bet If you're staying in Bangkok for a couple of weeks it's going to to be worthwhile getting a Rabbit card which is basically a prepaid pass for the BTS But it also gets you a discounted rate and vouchers for various restaurants in the city  I live and work here so if any further advice is needed just send me a message

reviewTitle: Efficient, good air con and cheap but...
reviewText: We (wife and I) found the BTS to be the quickest way around BKK even though we often had a driver on hand (through family)  The road traffic is often at a walking pace or slower so the BTS offers a brilliant and speedy way of getting around town    We typically had 4 stops to get to Central (Chit Lom) I think it was from Phom Phrong and this cost 28 bhat each way per person from the machine  The service was frequent and although often busy like the London Underground there was always room or another train shortly  A couple of points to note  the counters provided change to plough into the automated machines to buy one off tickets or you could get Rabbit cards which are essentially Oyster cards so it depends how much you intend to use it as to whether you PAYG or Rabbit  The other point is that like much of BKK (think pavements and lack of high chairs in lots of restaurants) the BTS is not particularly child friendly  We encountered very few escalators so carrying our 1yr old in the buggy up a lot of stairs along with the inevitable shopping bags meant we were very grateful for the good air con in the carriages    Otherwise awesome service all round and recommend as long as you're aware of the above  There is a downloadable BTS map in Play but no idea of other app stores   Hope the above helps

reviewTitle: The best reason for living in Bangkok
reviewText: Without the BTS I would not live in Bangkok I am retired and don't want to drive anymore Most of my daily commuting is within the BTS area It's always reliable and cost is appealing Once you get comfortable with the layout you can travel easy with the center of Bangkok The only downside is that it can get very crowded at rush hour Buy a Rabbit card so you don't have to keep buying individual tickets every time Please no eating or drinking on the skytrain system

Once you have a map in hand of the BTS you are set to see a lot of places in Bangkok To start with it will easily get you to and from the airport  My advice is to plan your daytrips with a copy of a map of Bangkok and the routes of the BTS It is possible to see many great attractions using the BTS system  The trains are usually loaded and be prepared to stand for a while All anouncements on the trains are made in English too which makes it easier to navigate The stations are really clean and its straightforward to get on and off the trains There is no long waiting either Trains run frequently and on time Ticket prices are astonishingly reasonable  much cheaper than taxi's tuktuks and motorcycles plus much safer I might add   We spent a week in Bangkok using only the BTS system and our feet It takes proper planning though but certainly no rocket science
