reviewTitle: Efficient and cheap way to get around
reviewText: My husband and I have visited Bangkok three years in a row and the Skytrain still remains a great way to get around ‚Äì clean safe and efficient and not to mention ‚Äì cheap   There is also good security on the platforms and at the entrance gates ‚Äì always willing to assist with the bypass gate if you have kids in pushchairs or have a lot of shopping bags   We purchased an adult Rabbit card (multiple trip pass card) on our first visit in 2011 and have used the same card on our subsequent two trips a year apart ‚Äì only having to top it up with either a trip bundle or with a Baht amount   If you are planning of spending a few days in Bangkok and making a lot of use of the Skytrain ‚Äì it is a good option to purchase a multiple trip card and load either the trip bundle (of which there are different options depending on how many trips you intend to take) or Baht as this will firstly save you money as the bundled trips are at a reduced rate and you don‚Äôt have to stand in a queue at the ticket machines which can be quite long in peak times and at stations near the tourist sites  They have a really good website in English which explains the route stations and attractions near the stations and all the info regarding the ticket system  The ticket machines at the stations also have an English option making it easy to purchase your tickets  The staff at the stations are great and there is always someone to assist in English when you want to know something or purchase the multi trip tickets and there is normally someone to assist at the ticket machines
It was a really sufficient mode of transport to get around Bangkok A bit tricky to work out which train we must get onto but once I figured it out it was really easy and fun to use Super cheap

reviewTitle: The best way to travel with lots of tips for newcomers
reviewText: This is the speedy way to get around Bangkok It is fast comfortable particularly well air conditioned and very frequent It is light years ahead of the London Underground Also known as the BTS it swiftly connects major parts of the city Interestingly it is the preferred " middle class" mode of transport and the travellers above will be so different to those down on the streets It seems that everyone is peering at their mobile device as they travel  Tips for newcomers  Access is not great for those with any impairment There are very few elevators and while there maybe an escalator from floor level this may start with steps and the next floor may be stairs It is invariably stairs down two long flights usually   The service interconnects well with the major Malls eg Siam Paragon Terminal 21 Central World and Emprium with walkways at "sky" level into the malls  There is a clear standing point to join the trains perfectly aligning with each door It is not a free for all like most subways Some stations have barriers by the platforms which open when the train arrives  Tickets are coin purchases for single journeys Some stations have machines that accept noteChange can be obtained from ticket offices ( at all stations) Ticket offices will not issue tickets for single journeys the machines have to be used They are straightforward but have a habit of rejecting perfectly good coins The tickets have a correct way of insertion shown by an arrow on one side They are retained at the end of a single journey  Alternatively buy a one day travel card for unlimited journeys 130 baht buys as many journeys as you wish before midnight Depending on length of journey For many tourists this is 45 journeys This ticket can only be bought at the ticket office  The service can be really crowded in conventional rush hours It runs from after 5 am until just after midnight   There are many shops and or coffee bars at ticket office level They vary by station There are cash machines ( ATMs) at almost every station There is a very good male female hairdresser manicurist at Nana opposite the ticket machines  Because of the difficulties of escalator access and lack of designated luggage space it is not great for carrying suitcases You cannot guarantee the train will be empty for to provide luggage space You see few pushchairs and even fewer people with disabilities  It interchanges well by walkway for river services at Saphan Taksin and you leave the station by the walkway which delivers you to the pier Watch out for beggars and those telling you the place you are going to is closed Best to ignore well meaning ( or not ) strangers as you study the maps They might flatter you by telling their great love for your home country but they WILL have an agenda  Station signage is very good Exits corresponding to hotels malls and other attractions are clearly labelled  All the platforms have a security guard supplied by G4S They can be identified by their military style uniform with a light blue shirt They can often be found standing at one end of the platform  There is an excellent mobile and data signal throughout  If this was helpful to you please vote accordingly

reviewTitle: The only way to travel in BKK
reviewText: Honestly when you are booking your hotel ensure you are no more than10 mins max walk from the skytrain   It is a blessing in the heavy BKK traffic it is super cheap and it is icy cold with the AC   It can get very busy at the peak rush hour times especially between 57pm but still it's probably 45 times quicker than a taxi and much cheaper

Unfortunately it is not always an alternative But if it is you should choose the BTS as yout means of communication around Bangkok It uses 3040 minutes on trips that takes 23 hours by car is easy to navigate and has great air conditioning Even during the rush hours it is not overcrowded It is even cheap if you are a traveler on a budget     Try to plan your hotel booking so that you are close to a BTS station It will make your life in Bangkok soo much easier It is reliable cheap and has easy access to the airport express and other public transportations

If you are in hurry and want to avoid traffic jams this sky train is the best option to reach the city centre But please be aware that this train will not be too comfortable if you have too many or big size luggage Not because the train has no space for your luggage but because your destination station might not be too friendly with your luggage (depends on the stationyou might have to drag your suitcase along the stairs before you can find any escalator and or elevator)  I always love the scenery along the way you can distinguish the different pattern of periurban area to city centre of Bangkok during your ride If you need to change to a taxi in Makassan or Phaya Tai just go down the station and find the taxi booth But again you have to be strong enough to carry all your luggage downstair without any cart

reviewTitle: Forget the taxi, take the skytrain
reviewText: If you are in central Bangkok forget taxi's take the sky train  Above the traffic it will get you there faster calmer with a sense of adventure  If you are venturing further out take the sky train to it's end and then board a taxi   Take it from a "native" expat we've lived here 12 years

Sky train is a great way to get around Bangkok since the traffic is always horrible We did save hours using skytrain instead of a car Ticket system is easy to useunderstand Skytrain can get very packedcrowded before and after working hours avoid those house if you can

reviewTitle: Best way to get around BKK
reviewText: The sky train is a great way to get around town It is inexpensive reliable and easy to use Highly recommended if you want to see the sights around Bangkok

Provides very good connectivity across Bangkok If you planning for shoppingSky train provides good connectivity to China Town MBK Mall Chatuchok market etcand you reach Suvarnabhumi airport in less than 1 Hr using skytrain Truly a best and economical way to travel in Bangkok But beware of cons and thugs on couple appearing to be returned from Dubaiwere asking us show Indian currancy when we said stubborn No they just disappeared so don't show your wallet to any stranger Other than that if you are cautious then there is absolutely no problem

The current outings in Mumbai about SkybusMono Rail & Metro Rail aren't on positive node Hence I feel lucky to get glimpse & experience of travelling through BTS  BTS is very well connected I saved MAP obtained from their website on mobile for convenience purpose  We opted for it when we went to ChatuchakJhatujhuk Market We took train at Phaya Thai & get down at Mochit   Both stations are equipped with MAPs written in English & Ticket counter staff also speak & understand it   Procedure of obtaining tickets(very simple & easy) 1) The ticketing system only works on Coins so first check out Fair for One way Return Journey towards destination on chart 2) Exchange Baht Notes with appropriate amount of coins(If you got enough coins skip this step) 3) Select desired station & Put coins into machine 4) Put ticket into validating machine & it will open the gate for you 5) Don't misplace ticket as its key to enter & exist station without it I found no way to enterget out of station  Inside BTS It was office closing hours so as expected it was rush inside but soon got cleared Victory Monument looked phenomenal Overall its easy to access & most convenient mode of transport  Tip Keep camera ready Many things too shoot & capture
The best way to travel Always on time no traffic and never says no ( like taxi drivers) Very cheap and easy to use Just buy rabbit card and it will take you on all public transport around Bangkok
A really good public transport system Cheap and frequent train service Servicing all the major centres around the capital
Fabulous system chaep and easy to useGlad to see they are extending the network too extremely clean with clear information announcements and freindly staff

reviewTitle: On time, AC and easy to use
reviewText: This service makes life in Bangkok simple and accessible Just watch out for the entrance and exit gates when carrying bags as the sensors cause the barriers to close on you before you are through

We found this mode of transport to be the best to get around the city to bet the traffic jams   It was easy to work out what ticket go buy for where you were going to go  Getting on and off was easy  Some of the stations have escalators one way but most are stairs updown to get to the platform  Would definitely use these next time in Bangkok

Heaven sent what with Bangkok's horrendous traffic jam Relatively affordable clean & scheduled like clockwork with important destination as its station Announcement on station stops are in dual language (Thai & English) Connected well with MRT & tickets machine are readily available   The website is informative enough to prepare you for your first trip

I generally consider using Skytrain to beat the traffic and reach my destination faster besides cheaper cost if we are 1 or 2 persons If 3 or 4 persons then Bangkok Cabs (on meter) is equally works out cheaper BUT there is a big traffic chaos Only if you are lucky you will not encounter traffic jam   I kept my Rabbit Card with me which I bought last year and it was very easy again Do buy it for easier travel at Skytrain   You can even buy an Baht 130 Full day pass if you feel you can extract the value out of it

Using Bangkok's Sky Train can be confusing at first but there are plenty of peoplestaff to help you They understand the issues that first time users tourists might have and get you 'on track' pretty quickly The Sky Train is a network of lines servicing the City of Bangkok which includes a line to the airport There are stations close to key tourist hotels in the city with easy access However the Train which is literally high above the road system and traffic is heavily used by the citizens of Bangkok to commute as much as it is by tourists The most popular use of the Sky Train that will  be relevant to you is the trip to the weekend Chutachuk Market The trip is quick and direct Yes you may have to stand but the carriages are air conditioned and the trip is short You also get to see a bit of suburbia on the way a bit of free sight seeing The alternative by road taxi or otherwise will be in peak hour traffic and stressful Take the Sky Train The fare to the Market is going to be about TB15

Initially we only used taxi and tuktuk but we wasted so much time caught in traffic jams that we decided to use the BTS skytrain  What a relief  We just needed to get ready enough 10 and 5 baht coins in hand check the fare on the 'fare info chart' then go to the ticketing machine press the button for that fare and insert the coins into the coin slot  Ticket comes out followed by change  Then off to catch the skytrain Surprisingly there weren't many crowds so we didn't encounter any jostling or pushing  What impressed us was the officer on duty inside the 'circular office'  We had some problem at one stop and couldn't get our card to work  She stood up immediately and called out to us and solved our problem within seconds  Thumbs up to such prompt and alert staff Yes we saved so much of our precious time when we used this public transport

We have just returned from Bangkok a city of organized chaos  BKK is known as the hottest city on the planet with a mean temperature of 28C (according to Travel Channel)  It is always hot and humid and unwalkable so the transit system is the way to travel  The skytrain is like an oasis of coolness and if NOT crowded stays cool however during rush hour it does get warm  The skytrain now connects with the subway system the MRT and because of this wonderful underground and overground transit travel you do not need to hire a taxi and sit in grid lock traffic for hours on end as the taxi driver plays Buddhist chants for you and tells you that his taxi is also a "Wat" (Buddhist temple)  Great airport link as well get from Suvarnabhumi straight into the city avoid buses taxis and speed off into the heart of BKK The Thai staff is helpful to aid lost "farangs" (foreigners)  The Thai people themselves went out of their way to help us  It is in their culture to have "kreng chai" (consideration for the other)  The skytrain and MRT are clean comfortable cool steady service and did I mention cool  The signage is both in English and Thai and if confused someone will always help you out  We had a wonderful experience in BKK a city we used to hate is now easier to love

reviewTitle: Forget the Bangkok Skytrain after fares hike
reviewText: The Skytrain when I first came here 9 years ago was a Godsend from the awful traffic but it soon became a overcrowded disorganised nightmare  It was impossible to sit unless you got lucky and someone got off near where you were standing  This has got worse since they restructured the fares recently instead of fares being in multiples of 5 and 10 baht they are now a mishmash of all sorts of numbers such as 24 baht 31 baht up to 52 baht (the maximum was 40 baht)  At the Victory monument station yesterday (a Saturday ) there were queues of about 200 people at the change booths lines of about 25 people per pay station all confused about what they had to pay and now they have to wait for change too  Impossible  One good result  on my short journey I could sit all the way because people have stopped using the Skytrain so much whether due to confusion or impossibility of operation I don't know  The idiots whi made this change should all be fired  why didn't they just hike all fares up by 5 baht and make it easy  Oh but this is Thailand where noting is simple or thought out in advance  Take a bus

The good reliable fast and easy to use  The bad very strong AC sometimes a problem when you come in sweating  on the train and on the way to Saphan Taksin stop (where the boats are) there is a well dressed and very sleek Thai "gentleman"  with good English and knowledge and with a mustache who approaches tourists and says he is a teacher and after some time talks you into going with him to the non tourist pier (where they charge you 1500 baht for private longtail tours of the river and sights) He managed to trick us on one day and then we say him pick up other tourists 2 days later

reviewTitle: Keep more coins or get a Rabbit save value card to travel thru Slytrain
reviewText: It is convenience to travel around Bangkok using BTS however you need a lot of patience  Most of the ticket vending machines only accept coins so before you can go to the machine to buy tickets have to first queue up for changing coins  At peak hours this queue is long  Now you have the coins then you can line up for tickets  So we end up buy a Rabbit card its a stored value card top up then can go saved a lot of time  This card have to deposit 50 baht and cost 50 more to purchase it sounds not worth to buy as we are only tourists but when you see those lines in rush hours you will not mind anymore  We did not return the card because it valid for 2 years maybe we will back Bangkok some days  Thats why I dont know that 50 baht deposit will return or not

Get a map of the BTS and MRT routes and mark on the map the nearby places of interest that you are planing to visit This will be your reference master plan for your Bangkok city exploration Our self planned vacation in Bangkok based on this map took us to the following placesMBKNational Stadium Siam ParagonSiam Ocean World Madamme Toussard wax museumSiam Discovery Centre MochitChatuchak weekend market Saphan Taksin PierAsiatique Riverfront ProtunamFashion marketBaiyoke Sky Tower & Restaurant Chinatown Siam Niramit Show (by MRT) AsokSukhumvitnightlifeTerminal 21hotel etc This is the best most convenient most reliable and most efficient way to move around Bangkok city The trains are few minutes apart don't get stuck in traffic jams and are close to main shopping centres hotels and places of interest Most of all you never have to haggle with a tuktuk or taxi driver for the fare and feel cheated afterwards The prices are fixed and the routes can be planned ahead for example you can stay in a hotel within 5 minutes walking distance to a station If you travel a lot in a day you can also buy a day pass that allow you to hop in and out anytime anyplace anywhere It connects with the MRT underground trains and all of a sudden the scope of your exploration is widened and your destinations become easy reach There are plenty of ticketing machines that show the exact fare for any particular station you target is easy to operate and gives you back absolutely correct change If not you can also get ticket (token for MRT) conveniently from the ticketing office Queues are efficiently handled and people movement in the tunnels overhead bridges elevators turnstiles and connecting platforms are smooth Directions are cleary displayed in readable English so you know exactly how to move like a "local" You only need other transport when you get out of town like going to the Floating Market or getting to the airport

The Skytrain is a great way of getting around Bangkok  And while it won't get you everywhere it just might connect with other modes of transportation that will such as the MRT (Metro)  And while it can be crowded at times it moves along swiftly beating being stuck in traffic at rush hour  If you'll be using the Skytrain a lot get the Rabbit Card which also offers you a number of additional discounts and deals

reviewTitle: good choice for wandering the heart of Bangkok
reviewText: The heart of Bangkok means great shopping centers  MBKCentral World Siam Center Siam square Siam Discovery Siam Paragon Kesorn Shopping center etc The traffic around this area is terribly crowded by thousands of cars from 10 am to 10 pm If you want to arrive heart of Bangkok and wander around by cheapest and fastest way I really suggest BTS skytrain Buying 1 daypass only150 bahts then you can get on and off  unlimitedlyIf you want to go shopping at Jutajak or JJ  market just take Suchumvit line ahead to Mor chit which is the terminal station There are many fantastic places you can visit by BTS sky train please ask for more information at customer care center  at Siam sqaure or any  ticket booths or visit this website httpwwwbtscothcustomerenmainaspx FastSafeConvenientInexpensive try it

The BTS sky train  system in Bangkok is really a great experienced It is cheap and also convenient to purchase the ticket with coinpaper note from the ticket touch screen machine as par locationYou may also take ticket from booth in respective counter and then give the coin like ticket to enter in the main area If any hazards may causing a typical sound with red light blinking if you want to carry your luggage through it you can take help from the guard call them to open the gate for easy move This BTS link all the major area and major big shopping mall The train is smooth with Ac and give proper acknowledgement for the station you need to arrive Lots of information food vendors souvenir shops and full location are guided on poster in the station  Visited December 2012

I was in BKK for a few years I often used to use sky train It was so convenient to move from one area to the other It's clean not so expensive for kids are as same price as for adults It connects between shopping areas So in my opinion it's not so convenient for tourists Although depends on where you want to go after getting off from the trainI think you will use a taxi to some architecture or markets etc In Thailand taxies are soooo cheap If you use the train with your friends(more than 4 or 5 people)it will take more expensive than 30minutes taxi  However train doesn't know traffic jam If you don't have much time I suggest the train

I find it useful only if both Point A and Point B is within walking distance from the BTS stations  However there are currently only 2 BTS lines and since Bangkok is so big it is more likely that BTS is not that convenient  I still ended up having to take a cab because my final destination is too far to walk  However you can use the BTS to avoid certain downtown areas with severe traffic congestion  Plan ahead of where you want to go consult the map to see which is the closest BTS station to your destination and hire other modes of transportation from that station

reviewTitle: fast & convenient way to see Bangkok CBD
reviewText: as a resident of bangkok for me it's a mean of transport that would get you through Bangkok CBD if you continue due East on Sukhumvit line you'll also see the eastern suburbs as it's now extended to eastern edge of Bangkok Purchasing ticket for single ride may be confusing Most ticket vending machine only accept coins (only few machine at couple of stations accept notes) you'll have to walk up to the counter exchange for coins then come back to the ticket machine (Yes the counter won't sell the single ride ticket directly to you) Multiple ride ticket can be purchase at counter though Avoid both morning and evening rush hour as Bangkokian commute to work and return home (06000830 and 16301930) you can take fullsize bicycle on skytrain at offpeak hours contact stationplatform attendent (although you might get 'stared' by other passengers  bangkok is not so bikefriendly)

reviewTitle: BTS is best to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: BTS is the best way to travel in busy Bangkok now Good price with punctuality Try to avoid business hour

Great way to travel after trying the (tuktuk)which a great once of and the local taxi cabs i find the sky train the most conveinent way to get to your destination its fast clean and good value for money

This can take you to most hotels major markets shopping malls and connection points for Bangkok sights in a rather short time Beats Taxis&TukTuks hands down Clean and convenient but needs more facilities for disabled and can be very crowded over the rush hour (of course)

reviewTitle: Bts is an easy and cheap way to move around bkk
reviewText: Its very convinient to use BTS in BKK especially when going to Sukhumvit areaThe trains are being equipped with aircons which are  very usefull in hot and humid weather BTS also has an interchange with MRT and Airport Rail Link ( from Suvarnahbum aiport) The only donwside is that BTS doesnt cover yet the whole BKK

I can not imagine moving around Bangkok (They call it BKK for short) without BTS It is so convenient comfortable (though crowded at times) frequent and well spread across important shopping entertainment and sight seeing locations The fares are quite reasonable and smart pass for long term stay is a way to go

reviewTitle: Great way to get around a traffic laden city
reviewText: Easy to use and clean Unlike the MRTMTR in HKSingapore the locals actually let passengers off the train before crowding onto it Faster than taxis and tuktuks of course with the added benefit that you don't spend the journey wondering whether you have been ripped off  I actually want to revisit Bangkok for a few days buy a 3 day pass and plan my trips round the Skytrain stations

reviewTitle: One of the three best ways to travel in Bkk
reviewText: MRT BTS and the Canal taxi The BTS can be a mad house from 7am9am 4pm6pm MF There are two lines the Sukumvit line ending at Mochit and the Silom line ending at the National Stadium next to MBK They upped the price by a couple of baht so it makes it a pain because its done in increments of 12baht vs 10baht (Current rate 313 baht per 1 US) The hub is Siam it is where Silom BTS and Sukumvit meet Asok is where you can catch the MRT if you get off at Rachtawithi and walk towards MBK you will cross over elephant bridge under that bridge is a water taxi that runs from Golden Mount (Grand palace area 1km) out to Bang Kapi Its also a great way to get around When you get on the BTS don't be a Farang and stand in the doorway move inside don't be the person the Thais are mumbling about showing no respect for the many people who use the BTS I speak Thai since I have lived in Thailand for over three years and nothing is worse than a traveler blocking the door with a giant backpack assuming everyone else has to walk around them Also remember to give you seat to women children and monks

The skytrain is certainly a great asset for Bangkok It is clean regular efficient and inexpensive Bangkok is renowned for it's traffic jams at all hours of thhe day The delays can be very annoying for a traveller on a limited time schedule The skytrain is the solution The steep stairways can be avoided if you take the escalator or the elevator Remember no food or drink is allowed this is strictly enforced And you can even watch Tai adverts The last train departs at midnight
There is no jam at all Train is cooling and fast It is not crowd as it is relative higher price compare to the motorcycle taxis
the skytrain is an easy way for you to get around in bangkok as their location are mostly near to tourist attraction

Bangkok's BTS Skytrain is truly world class It is clean fast and affordable  I just wish they have more ticket vending machines that have English instructions and that take paper bills instead of just 5 and 10 baht coins The lines at the ticket booths can get long at times especially during rush hour

reviewTitle: Great and cheap way to travel around Bangkok
reviewText: Although it only covers part of the city if your hotel is near one of the stations it's a great way to get around Cheap and easy to follow once you know what you are doing

reviewTitle: Best and fastest way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Spending 45 mins in a cab to travel one mile is not getting to your destination in a hurryHowever the Skytrain network is fastcleanairconditioned and inexpensive Trains run every few minutes and are normaly quite fullTickets can be purchased from ticket machines at the stationsAll in all very efficient

A modern train with lots of information ) you can buy a ticket by yourself just indicating where you want to drop off  VERY busy during the rush our in the afternoon ( bring many coins with you otherwise you might not be able to buy your ticket Trains are not so available for "paraolimpians"

reviewTitle: I wish the public transport in the UK could be as good as the skytrain in Bangkok
reviewText: A very good experience Get on one of them and you can stop at most of the shopping areas in Bangkok The aircon in the skytrain is working and the fare is very cheap They are always on time
Easy to use although can get a bit crowded but very clean and user friendly Easy to purchase the tickets from the machines cant go wrong really
Why can't every city in the world have this I find travelling around Bangkok by Skytrain the easiest way and have never had any problems navigating my way around
get a Rabbit card if you're using the skytrain a lot  you pay an additional 50 baht which is refundable (with any leftover credit) when you hand the card back in

What a no fuss way to get around Bangkok  Once you master getting your tickets it's a breeze The Siam stop is a great hub to  use and is right on the doorstep of shops sights and connecting to the other rail line

reviewTitle: Use it, it is the fastet way to get somewhere
reviewText: the skytrain is a good way to avoid the traffic jams in Bangkok It is easy to use has aircon and is cheap too

reviewTitle: Fastest and efficient way thru BKK
reviewText: Get on at Thaksin pier  Sathorn wher boats from hotels drop you and it is a 2 min walk to the trains Avoid rush hour but beats taxis in traffic on speed anytime

reviewTitle: Frequent and easy to use trains.
reviewText: Taxis on Sukhumvit take forever so take the Skytrain  Mingle with the students ladyboys and tourists  For usually around 30 BHT you can go anywhere  You ask the person in the booth for change and buy your ticket at the machines  The cost depends on how far you are traveling  You can also buy a multiple ride card or unlimited one day tourist card from the station booth  The glass station booth is always located right next to the turnstiles
Good system clean Only problem is it does not cover a large part of the city It would be useful if there were choices of either bus or train (sky train or underground)

reviewTitle: If only public transport in the UK was this nice!
reviewText: Very easy to navigate to your destination and very cheap to travel It's very modern and the cleanest public transport I've been on a lot of this may be due to no food and drink allowed on the service but that's not necessarily a bad thing Can get quite busy so at times you have to wait for the next train but everybody is civilised and no pushing or shoving  The air conditioning is a nice touch and adds to a pleasurable journey

reviewTitle: It saves your time and money
reviewText: Trafic in Bangkok is really bad You would lose most of your time in trafic Forget not to mention that taxis cost quite too much this would incluse tuk tuk as will Therefore the mist convinient way to comute in Bangkok is eithere by using the skytrain or the metro Both are great and take you to almost every where However using the train or metro means that you will have to walk a bit

reviewTitle: Great but limited to small part of the city
reviewText: the skytrain is a great way to travel in Bangkok and specially if you go to the Thomson house However the service and the lines only serves the east and south part of the city with is not good for any of the temples

reviewTitle: very convenient mean of transport in BKK
reviewText: It is the most convenient mean of transportation in a busy city like Bangkok The time tables are also well organized as well as the information The cleanliness and its air cooling system inside all berths is  very efficient The fare is also reasonable
Such a great way to get around the main parts of the city Not perfect but clean and generally efficient  not even that expensive Makes avoiding traffic that much easier

I did most of travellng along Sukhumvit on Skytrain Bought a rabbit card as I stayed for a week and got discounts on every trip Skytrain was really convenient for me & my family as it had direct walkway to the mall adjacent my Hotel Actually direct walkways are available at most of the Malls via Skywalk Only con I can mention here is lack of elevator escalator at every BTS was a bit hassle for me to carry my kid's stroller together with all the shopping bags)
Its great its fast its cheap its crowded its BANGKOK  Perfect way to travel around with this similiar to the SMRT in Singapore
Nice cheap quick way to get to where you need to go easy to use and great to get out of the heat you can get right up to the weekend market which was fantastic
The skytrain is good with nice interiors We availed the skytrain from nana station to visit mvk market The whole journey was

It's a comfortable way to travel in Bangkok There are 2 lines the Silom (National Stadium to Wongwian Yai ) and Sukhumvit line ( Bearing to Mo Chit) Both the lines intersect at Siam station Very convenient Also you can connect to Cental PierSathorn  MRT and the Airport Rail Link at certain Stations Get hold of a map which will help you to know the stations and the connectivity and which platform to wait  If you are making many stops in a day buy the day ticket at 130 bath which gives you unlimited travel on the day of purchase

The sky train is a good cheap way of getting around although it doesnt cover a large area ie major tourist points but then this would be a major engineering build to do this Never the less its a must use so try it

It's always a pleasure to ride the skytrain  it's clean fast and cheap and a great way to see Bangkok from above If you ever visited Bangkok in the days before the skytrain and experienced the almost constant traffic jams when on a bad day it could take several hours to cross the city to your destination you will appreciate how wonderful the skytrain is Of course it gets a little crowded in rush hour but most of the day there's plenty of room and as it's air conditioned too what's not to like

reviewTitle: Cheapest and quickest way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: We were lucky that our hotel provided a free ferry service to a pier close to a Skytrain stop Skytrain proved to be easy to use cheap very regular and comfortable

I use the Skytrain to go most places in Bangkok It's cheap fast and easy Look at the map for a time first and then use the destination codes to buy you tickets from the vending machines You'll need your ticket to get out of the system so don't loose it on the train
Excellent price (compared to underground transport in England) efficient and quick service  All machines were available in English so easy to navigate and buy tickets

reviewTitle: Speedy way to travel in bangkok
reviewText: Skytrain or BTS as they call it is a speedy way to travel in bangkok The tickets range from 30 baht to 55 baht depending on the distance to travel One can also buy a daily pass worth 130 baht for unlimited travels There is a facility of rabbit pass which will allow fixed number of travels at a cost This lowers the overall travel cost One can select the option based on his or her requirement  Please note the prices are based on rates in Aug2012 They are bound to change

The views from the skytrain are really good but you have to stand at least I did because it was quite busy and it doesnt seem to be the best way to get around the city because the network doesnt cover some places that I wanted to go which was annoying
Easy cheap and the AC feels fantastic The only disadvantage is that it doesn't take you everywhere in the city

reviewTitle: Escape Choatic traffic atleast in central part
reviewText: Though it wont take you every cornerattraction of Bangkok it pretty much covers central area it costs around 30 to 40 bahts maximum and day pass is available if traveling more frequently in day Also BTS and metro are both different and need separate tickets you feel a sense of satisfaction when you traveling in BTS by looking at chaotic traffic outside

We tried to use the skytrain a couple of times but found it to be quite a tiring experience trying to work out which BTS goes to which area (it seems some areas are not covered so we always had to take taxis at the other end anyway which kind of defeats the point) and buying tickets is a bit tricky

The Skytrain in the best way to get around in Bangkok There you can get to everything that you may want to do and get a cool ride to do it in Best bet for traffic ridden Bangkok Visit the city not the congestion Must use

reviewTitle: Best way to surf through Bangkok
reviewText: Love it   Fast easy cheap and beautiful way to move across Bangkok Just a pity that there's not more lines
Great to us the Skytrain to travel to places such as chatuchak and siam central Very convenient  The traffic in Bangkok are well know busy So travel by sky train would be the best idea
i prefer skytrain to taxis fast and convenient Like the sky walk as wellhowever can be too crowded at67 pm

reviewTitle: The way to go in Bangkok
reviewText: Gets you where you have to be on time and in a comfortable way Combine it with scooterrides where necessary and you're the fastest moving person in Bangkkok

reviewTitle: great way to get to distant areas of the city
reviewText: An excellent way to get to distant parts of the city The tram is clean and air conditioned Can be crowded at times but still a good way to see the city above the traffic
Perfect way of getting around the city Clean on time and the announcements are all in english From the airport it is so much cheaper than taxi or tuktuk and it takes you right into the city

reviewTitle: take it and stay out of traffic!
reviewText: i loved people watching on the skytrain everything is so well organized but there is crazy ac and it can be really cold

I always use the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok when I visit it's fast and cool and the stations are easy to access  The reason I give 4 stars and not 5 overall is because it can be very busy and often it's difficult even to get standing room at busy times

This is easily the quickest and most comfortable way to travel in Bangkok It is also economical if you are travelling alone However if you are a family of four a taxi may be the cheapest Stations are close to important points malls interchanges (MRTAirportLink and the river ) so getting around is easy Maps have the relevent information for the same  All in all my choice of travel around Bangkok

reviewTitle: fast and convenient way to get around bangkok
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain is a fast and convenient way of getting around Bangkok and it saves you a lot of time and money compared to taking cabs A lot of the cab drivers are crooks and would take a roundabout way of bringing you to a location so that they can charge you more Anyway back to the BTS Aside from being fast and convenient it is easy for tourists to figure out since there is English signage and there is a organized system The best part about it is that people actually queue to go inside the train doors which is a welcome change from the stampeding pushing and elbowing you see in the trains of other crowded Asian countries Bravo to the Thai people for their orderliness and discipline What needs improvement is that not a lot of areas are covered by the BTS and there are other train lines so it is a bit confusing unless you are a local or a veteran traveler

The skytrain in Bangkok is convenient and cheap it can avoid traffic jams but every time when we travel for the skytrain it is very crowded so sometimes we prefer to take MRT instead of that  Furthermore we need to call the staff to open the door next to the lift as we carried babytrolley sometimes we cannot find the staff and cannot use the lift therefore we need to carry the baby trolley to walk up and downstairs
Very easy to negotiate and to see where you are going Cheap and very reliable never had to wait for more than a few minutes for a train to arrive
A quick and easy way to travel  minutes walk to our hotel (Plaza Athenee) a great way to escape the traffic in Bangkok so accessible to all major shopping centres

this is the only way to move around Bangkok it is cheap cool and easy to follow the maps takes you to all the places you want to be and great shops on the main platforms if you like it buy it they are truly great bargains
The Skytrain made travel in Bangkok easy and affordable  Tickets are easy to purchase and don't forget to buy yourselves a day pass for 130 Baht if you'll be using it all day to get around

reviewTitle: The only way to get around Bangkok!
reviewText: It's just so easy and cheap  You don't have to argue with taxi drivers  We stayed at the Pullman which is Chong Nonsi station only three stops from Siam Centre and the glorious MBK shopping Mall (truly the best in Bangkok)

The Skytrain and the MRT are the only ways on how to effectively beta the Bangkok traffic You thought traffic in Brussels London Paris Rome was bad  Come to Bangkok This is bad and mad Unless you take the Skytrain that is Still gets crowded in the morning but the Thai are such lovely and respectful people that even an crowded metro is something enjoyable  Tip  if you plan to do more than threefour journeys per day  buy a day pass Thailand is cheap by European standards but the Skytrain can be pricey

reviewTitle: Clean, On Time, Cheap and Very Convenient
reviewText: Used it for a week never waited more than two minutes for a train It's clean super efficient and cheap Orderly embarking and disembarking People are respectful of your space and helpful if you need it
Bangkok's skytrain is very easy to use clean and modern Cheap way to get around Bangkok and quicker than taxis and better tha walking
One of the best ways to go around in crouded bangkokreally easy to learn the skytrain system and its really cheep

reviewTitle: The fastest & cheapest way about Bkk !!
reviewText: A day pass for 130 bht is great if you do a lot of travelling or use the ticket machines like the locals to get the ticket to the desired destination

reviewTitle: best and cheapest way to get around Bangkok during peak hours
reviewText: Bangkok traffic is famously slow and frustrating Particularly during peak hours of the day BTS (linked to Mtr) will get you around Bangkok cheaply and efficiently Maybe I have been lucky but in all the trips I have never once encountered a situation where the system 'is temporarily broken'  which is frequent in London and Paris
It is efficient clean aircon execellent announcement for next stop stations and above ground so you get a good high view of Bangkok

BTS has very clean stations which can be crowded during peak times but travellers are polite and queue accordingly to enter the train If you are in the city for a few days then it is cheaper to purchase a multiday use ticket ‚Äì a smartpass ‚Äì that allows you to store credit onto a magnetic card which can be topped up at any time The colourcoded signage is excellent so long as you know where you want to go and are not colour blind The exit signs will guide you to your destination easily and without having to exit onto the street level in some cases Some of the platforms exist onto an elevated concourse that allows you to walk above the traffic under shade and protected from the weather This is very convenient when the night markets move in and there is little space on the footpath for walking It is definitely much cheaper & nicer to use the BTS than catch a taxis around the city
It's the second time that we're in Bangkok and we take the skytrain It's very good and nice traveling

reviewTitle: Every big city should have one.
reviewText: Fast cheap no delaysmakes Edinburgh's tram project look third world Every station is well signed and i found it not too crowded

It gets you the most of the places a visitor needs If it does not you may want to talk to the nearest point of your destination and then take a cab especially in peak hours in the week except you are travelling in the wee hours or first thing in a Sunday morning

As public transport goes the skytrain is a cut above the rest It's cheap clean efficient effective and you can take in some nice sights of Bangkok whiles you're travelling around
Need transport in Bangkok Taxis are cheap but not all drivers speak English Bring a map to show where you wanna go Or else use the Skytrain Modern cheap and fast
i recommend getting around on this as its soo much cheaper and also very quick i found it easy to use especially easy as i dont have this system in my country
The best way to get around most of Bangkok especially if you are alone and dont have too much to carry  If there is 3 or 4 of you then the taxi is probably same cost but will take longer
Take the skytrain  easy as pie and cheap as chips Best way to get around and stupidly cheap Although Bangers is a great city to walk too
Clean cheap prompt and safe Used it the whole time in Bangkok Would recommend a hotel close to a skytrain station

reviewTitle: One of the best choice for tourist to travelling around
reviewText: Many destinations locating nearby the sky train so this is the easiest way to get there But in the rush hourit was so crowded In the early morning lying on your bed maybe the best things to do
use BTS better than taxi  stay away from traffics  easy access  clean and safe cool ride  beautiful decorated train  tv in cabin so entertain be careful miss off your station

Trains run on time signs all in English  Maps clear and easy to use  Very cheap to use  Only downside is that it isn't built as far as the Kho San Road area
Easy to use and near to some main tourist attractions Just shame it doesnt go round the whole city
One of Bangkoks great forward visions very nice public transport very cheap and clean way to get around Bangkok Only negative was not much in the way of seats but it is so quick it's ok

reviewTitle: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok, taxis can be helpful but this beats the frequent traffic jams.
reviewText: Skytrain can be very very crowded so if you're claustrophopic try to travel on it at lowpeak times such as before and after rush hour in the mornings  Weekends aren't too bad  But truly taxis are in high demand and traffic is always thick in Bangkok so train or an occasional tuk tuck for short distances is the way to go most of the time
Traveled on the train once and found the service to be fast clean and convenient Ticketing staff was helpful

We don't speak a word of Thai but the Skytrain was still super easy to use and manuever It was also really clean as they are strict about restricting food and drink It was also nice and airconditioned
Very nice clean and fast transportation option in Bangkok One big disadvantage of it is that it don't goes to Khao San road or somewhere near
The sky train is a very modern means of transportation fast and clean The only trouble is that it does not reach several areas of the city specially the historical sites

this time  we go around bangkok  and get experince by using local transporation instead of join the big tour by travel bus due to our hotel near the sky train station we  are very happy to try nice and cleansimilar with MRT in Singapore
extremely cheap but crowded the traffic in Bangkok is gridlock the skytrain atleast gets you to places quickly

excellent way to beat the traffic Wish we had it in LondonFast and cool way to fly across the city to different locations and to visit the great shopping mallsTry the sky walk from the skytrain at Siam to Central World terrific

reviewTitle: Convenient and cheap - avoids the traffic jams

I'm not a city dweller and sometimes get concerned when using transit systems during my travels  However the BTS in Bangkok is convenient once you accustomed to the ticket machines and you have a basic understanding of the stops  Asok is the stop that connects you to the subway and that in turn will get you within walking distance to the express train to the airport

skytrain is an easy and cheap way to make your way round in Bangkokwe found the trains clean efficent easy to use  and on  time

reviewTitle: convinient way to travel around bangkok

reviewTitle: unlike any public transportation I've seen

this is the first sky train ride and i enjoyed it not that crowded and noisy you should this one be sure to have pocket change when going on the ride its much easier and faster for you to  go in

reviewTitle: Quick way to get around the city.

reviewTitle: Good way to escape city traffic

make sure you get the multi ride pass Taxis can be cheaper if you have many people but the BTS is a good way to get around the bad traffic jams etc People are polite and they queue to get in the carriages so don't just barrel your way through

The best way to travel around bangkok 3 usp's include speed cost and comfort Very modern and safe way just like the spanking new dubai metro Buy a rabbit card and top up money into it for seamless travel

reviewTitle: The quickest, cheapest and best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Simple cheap safe and fully airconditioned carriages This is by far the easiest and best mode of transport to get around Bangkok (not to mention the quickest in light of the traffic congestion) The maximum single journey fare is 55 baht (¬£1) although savings can be made if you invest in a Rabbit travel card which can be purchased from the information desks at each station All signage is in Thai and English the staff speak English (some better than others) and their website is actually rather helpful (httpwwwbtscothcustomerenmainaspx) The network doesn‚Äôt reach all parts of the capital just yet but route expansions plans are in place for the future

The skytrain is my preferred method of transport in Bangkok Cars are very clean safe and trains run every 510 minutes so you rarely have to wait With buses taxis and tuk tuks the traffic can easily double your normal travel time but the BTS bypasses all that I always get a hotel near a BTS station and when sightseeing I take the BTS as far as I can and then (if needed) a tuk tuk to my destination Some taxis will not go across town during heavy traffic hours (most of the day) so BTS is often your only choice There is a security presence at each station and I've never felt nervous even traveling alone at night
I like very much becuase it is very easy  go to the city and anyway in cityA very good  with a convenient
the ticketing is hessle free The reach of the train is good Almost connects to all part of the city or connects to the MRT

reviewTitle: best way to move, but not disable frendly
reviewText: The BTS is by far the most convenient way to move in central BKK but if you travel with heavy luggage disabled people or kids and strollers keep in mind that most stations does not have elevators or lifts going down ( it seems that elevators are there for convenience not for access even going up you'll have few steps to access them from the road) It can be very crowded on peak hours especially in the morning
By far the Best fastest and easiest way to get around and if you include the new subway can't be beat

SkyTrain The best way to travel in Bangkok Bangkok traffic can be pretty bad the Sky train is a good alternative It was fast and easy to get on and off We tried using taxis but often at the malls there was a line at the taxi stand you had to wait up to 20 minutes just to get into the taxi they often it took another 3045 minutes to get to your destination The Sky Train was much faster and easier

reviewTitle: Crowded but people are not pushy

well connected to most parts of Bangkok  fast and short waiting times  Also good connections with other public transport

reviewTitle: good way to beat the traffic
reviewText: We tried the skytrain from the airport to the city and it was fast  I have always taken a cab from the airport to the city but it's always traffic specially during rush hour  The sky train is conveniently available from the airport  More affordable and faster than taking a cab  However if you are going to use the skytrain in the city it can be a bit tight  Also climbing the stairs can be tiring too after a long day of walking and touring the city

Take me to the my destinations on time  fast and reasonable price Especially connecting wtih MRT that made my life so easy

reviewTitle: Definitely the way to go to avoid notorious Bangkok traffic!
reviewText: During our trip to Bangkok over the weekend we took taxi's tuktuk and the BTS train  Hands down I will always opt for the BTS to avoid the traffic taxi and tuktuk fare hassle  When traffic on the road is heavy you will definitely get to your destination faster  and when traffic is light on the roads the BTS is a cheaper alternative albeit the lessdirect route  The BTS is clean convenient and airconditioned

reviewTitle: Scared of the infamous Bangkok traffic- Skytrain will save your day !
reviewText: Interconnecting most major parts of the city the BTS is probably one of the fastest most comfortable and convenient modes of Public transport in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Getting around Bangkok by Skytrain BTS
reviewText: Quickest way to get around Bangkok cheap and clean not difficult to understand routing and each stop announced on loud speaker runs early morning but finishes midnite a day pass is great value but you will still need to use a taxi to get to some attractions if taxi is a must then use the metre taxi as the Tuk Tuks are now a tourist rip off although i do recommend one tuk tuk ride just for the experience
The train is the cleanest I have ever been on It is also extremely easy to navigate and very cheap Oh and the air conditioning is a huge perk in steamy Bangkok

reviewTitle: Best means of transportation in Bangkok - SKY TRAIN ( BTS )
reviewText: This is the best way to get around most of the places around bangkokBut not every places are connected by skytrainFor example if you want to go to Indra market the nearest BTS station is Chitlom which is around 1015 minutes walk awayAlso if you want to visit Grand palace the nearest skytrain station is around 1520 minutes by tuk tukBut I would still recommend using sky trains as far as possible if you want to skip Bangkok trafficWe did the mistake of getting cab from Gem factory to Grand palace and it took us around 25 hours to get there (   So on the positive side 1It 's cheap 2Almost all major shopping areas are well connected  and in many cases the exit of the Station directly takes you into the shopping malls like Siam Paragon  MBK etc 3It 's clean and the process of taking tickets are very easy ( Self Serviced ) 4 There are security guards all the time on the platforms as well as near the ticketing counters  On the negatives  1Sometimes it can get very crowded  esp in late evenings
Super Convinient way to travel around the city conectiong to other routes and the subway got to visit alot this way

reviewTitle: Don't loose your nerves in traffic jam
reviewText: Bangkok's traffic is a nightmare and I don't understand why tourists are affraid of using the BTS or Skytrain There is only 2 or 3 lines everything is written in English and people really helpful For 1 or 2 USD it brings you to major destinations Taxi is cheap in Bangkok that's right but you can be stuck for 2 hours or more in the traffic (we did it)

The skytrain system is very clean safe and efficient  All signs are in Thai and English  The fare system is a little confusing at first (you have to know the fare cost for where you are going and then purchase a ticket for that exact fare each time you ride) and many of the stations have ticket dispensers that only take coins  There are ticket booths where you can get change at every station however but it just means having to wait in two lines (one for change then one for the ticket machine)    Once you figure out how it works it's quite easy and much quicker and more comfortable than taxis
You'll definitely want to visit the Skytrain to avoid the crazy traffic of Bangkok's streets  Easier and less hassle than trying to hail a cab with meter or dealing with the tuktuks

reviewTitle: Great way to get around the city

great clean system unfortunatelay with own ticketing So you have to buy tickets for Metro and Sky Train separately  two times queing and searching for change

reviewTitle: The best way to get around Bangkok

just over the road from the hotel and mbk centre we didn't travel far on the skytrain but it was on our "todo" list
a cheaper alternative to taxis and took took and you know where your going and how much your paying

reviewTitle: The only way to get around central Bangkok

Best mode of transportation in Bangkok Tuk Tuk(auto wallas) are all chor's one of them was trying to kidnap us when we were there as we had purchased and was in possession of gold ornaments If you are in bangkok wherever possible use sky train

Bangkok is such a surprise especially since the rest of Thailand is somehow less modern So the sky train is by far the biggest surprise 2 lines which are linked to the most coveted areas of Bangkok and a great day pass for unlimited travel AC is great
Public service is very good in thailand Btw i prefer to use mtr considering the air condition service No internet access in the platoform at all

One of the nicer carriages compared to mass transit rail systems in major cities but the network is still limited although they have made some extensions Still needs to have much more stations to make it a proper alternative to taxis which are still the best way to get around Bangkok (despite mostly being a bit crazy if not very crazy or even very very crazy)

reviewTitle: The way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: I have taken the Skytrain at least 20 times and never had any problem Never have I seen it as dirty as the counterparts sometimes are in New York and Manila or as crowded as the trains sometimes are in Tokyo What I do in Bangkok is defined by what I can do on the Skytrain
its an expereince to see the city thru the mobile semi air transport must do do take the week pass so that its economical

reviewTitle: Best and safest form of transport in bangkok. (And MRT SUBWAY)
reviewText: All the scamming tuk tuk's and taxi drivers are a waste of time They will smile at you and scam you without blinking an eye This is not only typical in Thailand but anywhere you go there is heavy tourism Take some time Map out where you want to go and look on the map where it is If it's in Bangkok there is likely to be a BTS or MRT near by You can download some free or paid apps that have them

reviewTitle: Excellent and convenient way to get around
reviewText: Cheap day passes for 180 bhat unlimited day travel Best way to get around Bangkok Get a map of the subway from the hotel and you will be set Must remember that the subway closes at midnight so plan well for late night sorties

reviewTitle: Excellent service apartment, good location and great service

reviewTitle: A rethink.  Time for BTS to wake up and fix its problems.
reviewText: Though the SkyTrain (and metro and airport link and bus rapid transit) revolutionized travel in Bangkok the system had several compromises which now make the SkyTrain a less than stellar system compared to peers in the region  with the possible exception of Kuala Lumpur's fragmented rail "system" 1 Train length and capacity  3car trains may have been fine in the first couple of years  But Singapore MRT trains for example are routinely 6 cars for a city with considerably lower population  BTS trains are packed to the point that some folks cannot board trains at some times  There's talk about 4car trains systemwide  Not enough  Time for 6car trains 2 The shortage of escalators may stem from tightwad tendencies plus poor planning at inception  BTS has mud in its eye when compared to the alternatives in BKK and elsewhere I know people who won't ride the SkyTrain because of this lack of escalators Let's get the mud out of your eye BTS and install more escalators 3 Shutting down the system at midnight (actually more like ~1140 PM) on Friday and Saturday  BTS can do better than this 4 Flow through stations at rush hour is worse than in Boston a system designed over a century ago  Time for BTS to renovate its stations for smoother passenger flow 5 Previously BTS had several shuttle buses to extend its service area  It dropped them  when it should probably have extended them (and perhaps made them no longer gratis but still reasonably priced and perhaps using the same tickets as the skytrain itself)  There are other issues  but progress on these would be a good start at getting BTS out of its mediocre complacency

reviewText: The BTS is an excellent option to travel within the city area with a great scenic view of the city  Airconditioned and decent in terms of cleanliness (Not close to the MRT at Singapore but much better than most of the trains in Paris )  However if you are more than one person travelling from a particular point it may also be worth it to check the cost of traveling by taxi as it may turn out to be cheaper Spl if you are to travel till the station by another mean of transportation For eg we stay near Baring BTS but to get there it costs about 50 Bhat by taxi Then for both of to travel say till Phrom Phon BTS Station would cost another 110 Bhat one way However in 110 Bht we can just take a taxi till our destination from the main road of our house   Also a lot of the tourist attractions may not be close to the stations so you may need to take a tuk tuk express boat  taxi or walk Do your research online   You could compare costs by checking the BTS Website  httpwwwbtscothcustomeren02routecurrentaspx# vs the taxi fare httptinyurlcom9hxegm3  It is still an experience and one should try it out if you are just visiting for a few days )

reviewTitle: Best Way To Get Around Bangkok
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain has been one of the best things to have been constructed in Bangkok It is clean cheap air conditioned & easy to navigate the two main lines  the Sukhumvit line & the Silom line It is a good idea to try & find a hotel near the line as you can then get to the best of the shopping (MBK Central World Emporium Chatuchak Markets) and great restaurants  If you have any issues trying to work out from the station maps how much it will cost you from one station to the next there are people at the counter who give change & can advise you how much to pay Unfortunately many of the stations only have stairs to access them (the odd one has escalator access or access directly from a shopping centre) so if you have problems with stairs or have small children you may find it a little difficult In saying that I took my relatively fit 80 year old Dad to Bangkok last year & he managed fine

If you want to avoid the rush at the change counterscarry your own change preferably many 10 bhat or 5 bhat coins  Carry your ticket card safely  If you choose to travel multiple times (business shopping pleasure) over 3 or more daysits useful to buy a Period Pass  httpwwwbangkokmetrocothticketaspxLang=En&Menu=13  Go to the bathroom at your Hotel since you will not find a facility at the stations  I always take the sky train from the airport to Makassan (then travel onwards within the city by cab)its cheaper (90 baht only) than a taxi from the airport to Makassan(250baht)

reviewTitle: convenient way to get around Bangkok and to/from the airport

I love how easy it is to BTS (sky train) It has 2 lines  There is the shorter Bang Wa to National Stadium (where the MBK shopping center is) or the Mo Chit to Bearing line There is an interchange station at Siam  Tickets fares start from 15 THB up to 55 THB  I recommend getting a Rabbit Card (travel card) and 30 day pass of 25 trips All up it costs approx 775 THB (200 for the card including a 100 THB loaded and 575 for the 25 trips) This works out to an average of 31 THB per trip which is perfect for me as I'm travelling a lot between the 2 lines  Plus it means I don't have to wait in line for a ticket vending machine  The trains come frequently and always only a few minutes apart They are air conditioned and they announce their arrivals in both English and Thai   All signage has english at each station so you can't get lost   All in all I love using the BTS and I wish my home country had such an awesome set up  Do note that during peak hours (7am to 9am and from 4pm to 6pm) it can get busy and packed

reviewTitle: Fast, efficient & inexpensive way to travel
reviewText: For many destinations the elevated rapid transit system BTS Skytrain is the fastest and best way of getting to and from locations at or close to BTS (Bangkok Mass Transit System) Station stops It is easy to use but the key is distances from the stations The other travel options in Bangkok include taxis tuktuks underground MRT rail systems buses river taxis and express boats Tuktuks are fun but after a few rides you might want to change to something giving off fewer fumes and a little more comfortable Taxis tuktuks and buses are impacted by many traffic jams Thus I prefer the Skytrain Not only does it avoid traffic jams by going above them but you also get a highlevel view of the city Since the Skytrain system is elevated you‚Äôll have to walk up and down stairs or when available go on escalators to get to and from the platform level En route you will see markets the architecture of many city buildings lots of roads congested with cars tuktuks and buses Some people and trafficpolice will be wearing breathing protection because of the high level of polluted air    The elevated Skytrain has two lines the Sukhumvit Line and the Silom Line and 35stations At a few stations one can change to the MRT underground railway and the ARL Airport Rail Link    For our stay at the Hilton Sukhumvit Bangkok we were a fiveminute walk to the Phrom Phong BTS Station To go from the Hilton Sukhumvit to the Grand Palace we took the Sukhumvit Line from Phrom Phong Station to Siam Station where we changed to the Silom Line Then we went five stations to Saphan Taksin Station and took Exit 2 to the Chao Phraya Express Boat which we took to Ta Chang Pier No9 From there the Grand Palace was a sevenminute walk

reviewText: The skytrain has been around for a while now so for anyone who has not yet used it when visiting Bangkok give it a try You can buy tap on  tap off cards like those used in London or Sydney and the services are as frequent as most metros Most stations has escalators most but not all of the way up A few like the station near the weekend markets have lifts which work most of the time Ease frequency and the views are real pluses but frankly for a temperate climate person the chilly air con is a great relief from the days when I walked kilometres from one place to the other Of course the other must way to travel is the cheap express boats on the river  cool fast and a mix of travellers and normal city folk A couple of warnings for the uninitiated Try to avoid buying your Skytrain card in the middle of rush hour  I am always slow and that's an annoyance to the workers trying to get to work Also there are seats and spaces reserved for monks and it's the highest insult to ignore this

reviewText: Pros 1 Save time avoiding the infamous congested traffic in BKK (see the first photo) 2 Value for money travelling cost compared to taxi 3 No hassle of bargaining with tuk tuk and taxi drivers Cons 1 Very crowded be cautious of pick pocket 2 Be prepared for the long Q at the ticketing counters and machines (see the 2nd photo)
Slow glide along BKK skyline It's nice that they always maxed out the AC on the train because the weather outside was always humid
The stations were clean and staff helpful I used on many days to cross the whole city Reliable trains every few minutes

The Skytrain is on 2 levels The first level can only be accessed by steps (unless you are lucky and your hotel links straight to this level) With a small child in a push chair it was very hard to get up You get your tickets on this level and it is also possible to use this level to walk to different part of the city missing all the traffic  The trains are accessed on the second level Again lots of stairs but this time there are lifts but most of them don't work   You cannot eat or drink on the platform or trains and this is strictly enforced For a city that is around 30degC with 100% humidity this seams strange as not drinking could easily lead to dehydration  The trains themselves are clean blessedly cool and fast One thing to watch out for is some station (one near the river) only have one platform which services trains going both ways So watch out for the train destination on the front of the train (there are no other signs to tell you which train is coming next or where it is headed)
Great system Easy to use and very cheap Staff helpful Can be busy but felt really safe Does not cover lots of the city for example to see the palace then plan
A great way to travel in bangkok  always on schedule no delays It as air condition what is great  and it¬¥s not expensive

reviewTitle: Fast efficient and easy to use.
reviewText: The BTS is super easy to use The staff selling tickets speak good English and are helpful with directions The trains are very efficient but a little crowded  Would definitely recommend giving it a try to travel around Bangkok
Very convenient  For a firsttime visitor to Bangkok it is not that difficult to go around Bangkok if you take the BTS  Highly recommended and within budget

reviewTitle: Good way to get around town
reviewText: The first time I went to Bangkok I only took Taxis However the Skytrain is a much cheaper in some cases also faster way to get around town as you won't be stuck in traffic Also with 30 to 40 bath it is much cheaper

The BTS is a very good way to get around Bangkok quicker than car as the roads are congested It can very packed and you sometimes have to wait for another train to fit in

reviewTitle: Quick and easy to use, reasonably priced too
reviewText: Don't be concerned about not speaking the local language help is available and if you speak English all information is provided in English too We were not the only nonlocals to use the Skytrain and felt safe and comfortable at all times  The Skytrain is air conditioned too so nice to travel on  The trains are frequent and clean onboard
1100 of the taxiprice an quicker plus fresher then any other from of transport  Plus one gets the extra tour of the town for free

We enjoyed with the trip in skytrain Very easy to find and go And you can save time as trafiic is terrible in bkk

We spent a day using the BTS after purchasing a day ticket (I think it was 140 bht each) just to do some sightseeing around Bangkok lovely fridge like temperature upon the BTS which is an added bonus Very easy to use and well organised system to board and get off the train electronic maps that show stations yet to visit along the line in green and visited stations in red so really easy to navigate All announcements are in Thai and English again making the BTS simple to use if you're not in a rush you can wait for the next train if the carriage is busy It does get really busy after 4pm We also used Taxis and Tuk Tuk's in Bangkok and the BTS was by far the quickest way to travel the city as well as having a welcome break from the heat

The BTS is a great way to get around certain parts of Bangkok and by looking out of the window you sometimes get a glimpse of what the city looked like before most of the gardened traditional homes got torn down to make way for malls & condos Of course the arrival of the BTS (and the network is expanding rapidly) merely serves to speed up this process as land prices close to stations skyrocket Consequently some of the most unspoilt parts of the city are where the BTS has not arrived Avoid morning and evening rush hour if you can and don't expect any personal interaction everyone's phone is 20 cm from their face Some stations interchange with the MRT (underground) but confusingly the stations have different names

reviewText: For a tourist Time is precious too precious to waste inside a cab idling in Bkk traffic Using the expansive network of BTS is the way to see the sights of BKK end to end more cheaply One MOST noticeable thing a PLEASANT attribute of BTS you feel safe as there are no teenage gypsies out to slash your bag or snatch your wallet as you enter the stations or stand on the platformsa usual bane of the modern subways in Europe But still better to be ever vigilant as a tourist in any strange country

While in Thailand we were able to save quite a bit of money and time (the roads are so busy when you get a taxi) using their rail network  The MRT and BTS have been set up to be very accessible and easy to use  we were very impressed with Thailand's ability to move some many people around and we found it all very easy to understand (as a couple that can only speak English)  1  Don't stress if you miss the train there will be another one in a matter of minutes 2  When you purchase your travel card (BTS or token on MRT) the first time just scan your cardtoken and then on exit put it into the turnstile slot  Plan where you need to go and then you can like all rail networks they will call out the approaching stations on route  You may also need to move across train networks (some areas are serviced by the MRT and others by the BTS)  It is really way more stress free than getting a taxi as there are no language barriers and you know exactly how much it will cost you before you set off  Happy trails and enjoy Bangkok
I lived in BKK for 3 years and used the BTS and MRT (subway) as much as possible Clean comfortable easy to use and inexpensive way to get around the city Avoid rush hour

reviewTitle: fastest transport in Bangkok - nice view - freezing cold
reviewText: Traffic in Bangkok is one of the worst in the world Even if you have your own car or get a taxi if you're passing through the city centre (or basically anywhere in BKK) you'll get stuck waiting loooooong time SkyTrain passes through the main attractions in the city and central area with which you can skip the traffic What I like most is that it's fast and independent than the terrible traffic Also I liked the fact that it goes very high so you have a very nice view of the city ) The bad thing is that it's always freezing cold inside the trains Imagine Bangkok having a tropical climate outside temperatures are mostly warm (let's say around 2530 C) and humid so you sweat outside And then you enter the train which is around 15 C It's a big change But anyways that's the only downside  In rush hours when it's very crowded you'll see people make a very proper queue to get into the trains so proper that I have never seen in any other city (having traveled to 60 countries) I appreciate that a lot   If you're staying in BKK for a while better but one of these cards which you can pop up It's much easier to use this Your other option is to pay for 1ride but in this case you'll mostly be waiting in a long line to get your ticket (there's almost always line) and then you should also define where you'll get off and pay accordingly However with the card you pop up you can get off anytime you want It'll take the money according to how many stations you traveled (you show the card at the exit gates too so that it knows)
Great way to get around busy bangkok I was staying in main Sukhumvitand used this service numerous timesvery cleanvery organized

reviewTitle: Comfortable and easy to access, so choose your location wisely
reviewText: Use google maps to see if your Hotel is located within walking distance Some Hotels offer a shuttle which is convenient

This is a great way to get around We bought our swipe card and loaded it up Everywhere you'll find maps charge stations and friendly people to help you get to the right platform When you get to the platform the barriers only open once the train has stopped The trains are beautifully airconditioned and are kept clean and most display or announce the next station And nice and easy way to travel

reviewTitle: Best ride if you do not want to stuck in traffic!
reviewText: The BTS Skytrain services are a long overdue but already established features urgently needed in Bangkok In the near future more lines will be opened I comment only on the Sukhumvit line (Green Line) as it connects the most places in the business and shopping center of Bangkok The prices are decent and quite cheap in western terms However the infrastructure lacks behind as more and more people (after its extension farther south) are using this transport It is recommended especially when you travel with luggae kids etc to avoid its service during rush hours  6am10am and 5pm930pm as it is packed with people  The BTS management is unfortunately very profit oriented  as can be seen for all the commercial noise pollution they produce within and outside the train and its station  and reluctant to extend the carriages and frequencies required during rush hours Hence its very uncomfortable to travel on the trains during these times
Highly impressed with travellers queuing to get on train in an orderly fashion and no pushing or shoving involved Fast and clean
Bangkok has all the possible transport facilities from Tuk Tuk to Sky Train this expereince is really good and gives one the opportunity to have a birds eye view of the city

reviewTitle: Good service. Fast reliable and comfortable
reviewText: I couldn't use the self service machine to get my ticket but there are staff in counter and they sell the tickets to you  Service is comfortable and timely Saves a lots of time But not comfortable to carry lots of luggage

This is a great way to get around as it connects most parts of the city You can connect to the MRT underground at a variety of stations as well as the airport rail link it's a quick and cheap way of getting from airport to central Bangkok ( Siam or chit lom) around   70Bht The line now goes across the river to Bang Wa so staying on that side is no longer an issue if you want to get to the central shopping and eating destinations or if you want to catch the boat services on the river from other arias of the city  The service runs until midnight and is quick clean and a welcome break from the heat and humidity( especially in September) if you plan on using it a lot you may benefit from buying a day pass be aware that this only lets you use the BTS and not the MRT or other transportation in the city

Do note that that ticketing machine only accepts coins So you have to queue at the ticketing office to get small change and then queue again at the ticketing machine to purchase tickets Be mindful to check your change at the ticketing office as the officers have a habit of short changing your 100 baht with only 80  85 baht change

reviewText: The train only two railways in both direction so it is not at all hard to get on and get to your destination Just FYI when asking some of the agents they do not understand one gave us wrong direction so I mapped quest the direction but also if you have internet you can use your phone and it gives you each stop you need before getting off and on So very helpful tool I have to say this was extremely easy to travel by train and took you to all the stops for different attractions The train rides were 1560 baht which is anywhere from $25$125 each ride which is not bad at all Plus the traffic in Bangkok is horrific Unless you have a tutu it still can be difficult and your stuck to go a few miles so the train came in very handy during the high traffic hours
